loans.name: Paulo

texts.es: Paulo es un joven de 22 años muy alegre y trabajador, vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes quiere dar una vida digan y tranquila. Desde que tenia 16 años ha trabajado en el negocio familiar, junto a sus padres realizaba el acopia de fibra de ovino. Actualmente, continúa con esta actividad, pero ahora lo hace de manera individual, ayudando así con los gastos familiares. Paulo compra a los ganaderos la fibra de sus ovinos, para luego llevarla a vender a otras ciudades, como Cuzco, Tacna, etc. Lleva 2 años realizando este negocio y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede continuar con la tradición familiar, además espera que en el futuro su negocio crezca y pueda recolectar mucha más fibra, para vender en más lugares. Para Paulo lo difícil de su trabajo es recolectar la fibra, puesto que tiene que ir a lugares muy lejanos, aun así esta dispuesto a poner todo de su parte para alcanzar sus metas. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, en su primer crédito fue muy puntual y espera poder serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es muy querido, ya que siempre es respetuoso con el resto de las socias. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita incrementará su capital de trabajo, así podrá comprar más fibra de ovino y vender a más clientes.
texts.en:
Paulo is a hard-working and cheerful young man, 22 years old, and lives with his parents, to whom he would like to provide a decent and tranquil life. He has worked in the family business alongside his parents since he was 16 years old, buying up raw wool fleece. He is currently still doing this, but now does it on his own, thereby helping out with the family expenses. Paulo buys raw wool from local sheep farmers and later takes it to other cities such as Cuzco and Tacna to be sold. He has been in business for 2 years and what he likes most about it is that he can continue the family tradition. He hopes that in the future his business grows and he can collect even more wool fleece to sell in other places. For Paulo, the most difficult part of his job is collecting the fleece because he has to travel to many faraway places, but even so, he is willing to put all his effort into reaching his goals. This is his second loan with MFP. With his first loan he was very punctual with repayments and expects to do the same now as well. He is well-liked in his communal bank because he is always very respectful to the other members. With the 1,500 soles he requests he will increase his working capital so he can buy more raw wool fleece and sell to more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es: Carlota es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por salir adelante, a sus 59 años ha conseguido tener su propia casa, todavía tiene muchas fuerzas para seguir trabajando y velar por el bienestar de su única hija, Nery de 20 años. Es una madre muy amorosa, se dedica al negocio de la venta de ropa y es muy solicitada por sus clientes, a quienes siempre recibe muy contenta, ya que sabe que ellos son muy importantes para el progreso de su negocio. Su puesto está ubicado en el mercado Túpac Amaru (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), donde vende casacas, chompas, pantalones, etc., lo que más le gusta de su negocio es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, a quienes siempre hace reír, debido a la alegría que le pone a todo lo que hace. Lleva 20 años en este trabajo y lo que menos le gusta es permanecer todo el día en su puesto, ya que a veces desea salir a disfrutar de los rayos del sol. Carlota anhela tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender más prendas y atender mejor a sus clientes, sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para mejorar su vida. Es su segundo préstamo con MFP, está muy contenta de haberlo obtenido y tiene mucha confianza en que lo pagará a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy respetada, ya que siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita comprará más ropa para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Carlota is a woman who has always struggled to get ahead. At her 59 years she has been able to acquire her own home, and she still has the strength to keep on working and look after the well-being of her only daughter, Nery, who is 20 years old. She is a very loving mother and works in the clothes-selling business. She is very sought after by her customers, who she happily attends to as she knows they are very important to her business. Her stand is located in the Túpac Amaru market (an important market in Juliaca) where she sells coats, sweaters, pants, etc. What she likes most about her business is talking with the other sellers, who she always makes laugh because of the good mood she is in all the time. She has been doing this type of work for 20 years and what she likes least about it is having to stay all day at her stand, as sometimes she would like to go out and enjoy the sun. Carlota hopes someday to have a bigger store where she can sell more clothing and take better care of her customers, and she knows she has to work hard to improve her life. This is her second loan with MFP. She is pleased to have it and is very confident that she will repay it on time. She is respected in her communal bank and always gets their meetings under control. With the 2,000 soles she is requesting, she will buy more clothing so she can have more goods to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su propia casa, junto a sus 3 hijos; Miguel de 29, Tania 21 y Katerine de 6 años, a quienes quiere dar un buena vida. Se dedica al negocio de la venta de productos variados, vende licores, vinos, chocolates, shampoo, etc. Tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado Tupac Amaru (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), donde atiende a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad, ya que sabe que de ellos depende el éxito de su negocio. Lo que más le gusta a Delia es vender sus productos y ver como sus clientes se los llevan muy contentos, lleva 8 años trabajando duro para salir adelante, espera poder poner un negocio de venta de artefactos eléctricos en el mismo mercado, con el cual pueda incrementar sus ingresos. Lo difícil de su trabajo es mantener surtido su puesto, ya que los productos que vende se acaban rápidamente y a veces no le alcanza el dinero para reponer la mercadería. Este es el segundo préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y para ello está dispuesta a ahorrar poco a poco, en su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada ya que siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita incrementará la cantidad de productos que tiene en su tienda, para así ofrecerles a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Delia is a very hardworking woman who lives in her own home along with her 3 children: Miguel, 29; Tania, 21; and Katerina, 6. for whom she wants to provide a good life. Her business is the sale of various products; she sells alcohol, wine, chocolate, shampoo, etc. She has a small stand in the Tupac Amaru market (an important market in Juliaca), where she takes care of her customers with friendliness, as she knows the success of her business depends on them. What Delia likes most is to sell her goods and see her clients go away happy. She has been working hard for 8 years and hopes to be able to start up a business selling electrical appliances in the same market so that she can increase her income. What is difficult about her work is keeping the business stocked, as the goods she has sell out quickly and sometimes she does not have enough money to restock the merchandise. This is her second loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make her repayments on time and she is willing to save little by little. She is a respected member of her communal bank who always keeps order at the meetings. With the 2,000 soles she requests she will increase the amount of products she has at her store so that she can offer greater variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory of merchandise.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma de 45 años, es una madre de familia muy preocupada por el bienestar de sus hijos, vive en la casa que consiguió con mucho sacrificio y que cuida con mucho esmero, ya que sabe que algún día se la dejará a sus hijos. Para Irma la venta de licores es un negocio muy rentable, ya que su puesto está ubicado en el mercado Tupac Amaru (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca) y debido al gran movimiento comercial siempre vende mucho, ella es una persona muy alegre y siempre realiza sus ventas con una sonrisa bien grande. Lleva 20 años en el negocio y lo más difícil de su trabajo es comprar los licores, ya que existen muchas bebidas falsificadas y tiene que saber diferenciarlas. Para el futuro Irma desea tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender de todo y no solo limitarse a los licores, lo que más le gusta es conversar con sus clientes, ya que mediante ellos se puede enterar de muchas cosas que suceden mientras está en su puesto. Este es el segundo préstamo al que accede con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en su primer ciclo y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre les da consejos a las demás socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados implementará mejor su tienda, comprará más licores y les ofrecerá una mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Irma is 45 years old and is a mother concerned for the well-being of her children. She lives in a house she acquired through much sacrifice and that she takes great care of, as she knows that some day she will leave it to her children. For Irma, the sale of alcohol is a very profitable business. Her stand is located in the Tupac Amaru market (an important market in Juliaca) and because of high traffic she always sells a lot. She is a very cheerful person and always makes her sales with a hugh smile. She has been in business for 20 years and what is the most difficult is purchasing the alcohol as there are many falsified products and you have to know how to tell the difference. In the future Irma would like to have a larger store where she can sell many goods and not just limit it to alcohol. What she likes most it talking with her customers, because them she finds out from them what is happening while she is at work. This is her second loan with MPF. She was very punctual repaying her first loan and hopes to be punctual now as well. At her communal bank she is very happy and always giving advice to the other members. With the 2,000 soles requested she will stock her store, buy more products and offer a better variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.
Eulalia es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 1 hijo, Eulalia tiene un puesto en el mercado D. Carmen Alto en donD. venD. papa, producto que compra D. los productores y también Eulalia se dedica a L. siembra D. papa en sus tierras D. Alpachaca.
Eulalia necesita un  préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. papa.
Eulalia sueña con tener carro propio para transportar sus productos y que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
Eulalia is a member of the Nobleza (Nobility) Communal Bank. Eulalia is 34 years old with one son and lives with her domestic partner. She has a stand in the Carmen Alto market where she sells potatoes which she buys from farmers and which she also grows herself in her fields near Alpachaca. She needs a loan of 2,000 Sols which she will invest in purchasing potatoes. Eulalia dreams of having her own car to transport her products and she wants her daughter to one day become a professional person.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.
Edith es soltera, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, Edith tiene un recreo llamado EL KUTUTO ubicado en el barrio tradicional de Conchopata, en donde vende platos típicos de la región, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de 5 personas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Edith necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cervezas, cuy.
Los sueños de Edith son comprar un terreno para construir un local propio y tener estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Edith is a member of the Nobleza Communal Bank.
Edith is 26 years old and a single mother with one child. Edith runs a stand called El Kututo in the traditional neighbourhood of Conchopata, where she sells typical regional dishes every day with the support of 5 other people.
Edith needs a 1000 soles loan to purchase beer and cuy (guinea pig).
Edith dreams of buying land to build her own establishment and of having economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer and cuy.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 33 años y vive en su propia casa, con sus 2 hijos; Wendy de 8 y Juan de 3 años, lo que más quiere es darles unos buenos estudios. Ella es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por mejorar su vida, tiene un puesto de ropa en el mercado Tupac Amaru (Mercado Importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), vende casacas, pantalones, buzos, etc., pero todo para niños y lo hace a un precio muy accesible, es por eso que su puesto es muy concurrido por los clientes. Para Lucy lo más difícil de su trabajo es conseguir la ropa que vende, ya que es muy exigente con sus proveedores, espera tener en el futuro una tienda de ropa más grande donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más disfruta de su trabajo, es ver como le queda la ropa que vende a los pequeños clientes, puesto que a ella le gustan mucho los niños. Lucy desea que su negocio progrese y poder tener una mejor vida. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, al igual como hizo con su anterior crédito, desea pagarlo a tiempo y sin dificultades, en su banco comunal es muy respetada, ya que es la socia más activa y comprometida. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita planea comprar más mercadería y así incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Lucy is a very hard working woman of 33 years and lives in her own home with her two children, Wendy, who is eight years old, and John, who is three. What she wants most is to give them a good education. She is a woman who has always strived to improve her life. She has a clothing stall in the Tupac Amaru market (the major market in the city of Juliaca) and sells jackets, pants, sweaters, etc. - everything for children at very affordable prices. That is why her stall is very busy with customers. For Lucy, the most difficult part of the job is getting the clothes she sells, as it is very demanding dealing with the suppliers. She hopes in the future to have a larger clothing shop where she can sell with greater ease. She has been doing this work for 15 years and what she enjoys most is to see how the clothes that she sells to her young clients look, because she is very fond of children. Lucy wants to advance her business and be able to have a better life. This is her second loan with MFP and like she did with her previous credit she wants to pay on time and without difficulties. In her community bank she is very respected because she is the most active and committed member. With two thousand new soles that she is asking for she plans to buy more merchandise and increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise inventory

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.
Julia es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Julia tiene un puesto en un mercado en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su cuñado, además Julia vende medicamentos naturales.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales, arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Julia son ahorrar para los estudios de sus hijos, mejorar y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Nobleza (Nobility) Communal Bank. Julia is 23 years old, has a son and lives with her domestic partner. She has a stand in a market where she sells groceries mostly, and she also sells natural medicines. She does this every day with the help of her brother-in-law. Julia needs a loan of 2,000 Sols that will be invested in the purchase of cereals, rice and sugar. She dreams of saving up money for her children's education and to improve and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciana es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.
Feliciana es casada, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Feliciana tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, bebidas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. sus hijos, además los días sábados y domingos viaja a las ferias en donD. venD. ropa y calzados.
Feliciana necesita un préstamo D. 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, fideo y aceite.
Los sueños D. Feliciana son tener un carro para transportar sus productos, surtir su tienda e implementar una tienda D. venta D. ropa.
texts.en:
Feliciana is a member of the Nobleza Communal Bank.
Feliciana is married, 43 years old and has 4 children. With her children's help, Feliciana runs a store from her home selling general groceries, vegetables and beverages. On Saturdays and Sundays she also travels to markets to sell clothing and shoes.
Feliciana needs a 1400 soles loan to purchase rice, sugar, pasta and oil.
Feliciana dreams of having a car to transport her products, of stocking her shop and setting up a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, pasta and oil.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.
Sabina es casada, tiene 51 años y 8 hijos, Sabina tiene un puesto en el mercado Vivanco en donde vende carne, los animales los compra en las ferias de la región. Además Sabina se dedica al engorde de animales.
Sabina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdos y comida balanceadas.
Los sueños de Sabina son tener una granja de pollos y que sus hijos estudien para ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Sabina is a member of the Nobility Communal Bank. Sabina is married, 51 years old, and has 8 children. Sabina has a stall at the Vivanco market where she sells meat from the animals she buys at regional markets. In addition, Sabina works fattening animals. Sabina needs a loan of 1,000 soles, money which she will invest in the purchase of pigs and balanced nutrition. Sabina dreams of having a chicken farm and that her children will study to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs and balanced nutrition

loans.name: Yovana Zenaida

texts.es:
Yovana es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza
Yovana es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo, Yovana tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual de su esposo.
Yovana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo.
Los sueños de Yovana son construir su casa e implementar otro negocio.
texts.en:
Yovana is a member of the Nobility Communal Bank. She is a common-law wife, is 22 years old, and has one son. Yovana has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, and meats. She works every day, sometimes with the help of her husband. Yovana needs a loan of 1,000 soles, money which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, and noodles. Yovana dreams of building a home and starting another business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar and noodles

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es: Nelida a sus 23 años, sabe que es hora de apoyar con los gastos económicos en su hogar, vive en la casa de sus padres, quienes le ayudaron a poner su negocio. Es una joven muy alegre y preocupada por salir adelante, es por eso que decidió poner una tienda de licores, con la cual le ayudaron sus padres, su negocio siempre es muy concurrido, ya que vende sus productos a precios muy cómodos. Le gusta su trabajo, disfruta mucho de aconsejarles a sus clientes cual es el licor de mayor calidad que pueden comprar, desea tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender toda clase de licores y así incrementar sus ingresos. Lleva 2 años realizando este trabajo y lo más difícil es conseguir los licores, ya que existen muchas bebidas falsificadas y de mala calidad, las cuales tiene que saber diferenciar. Este es el primer préstamo que solicita en MFP, y desea pagarlo a tiempo, ya que quiere acceder a otros posteriormente, se está siendo muy querida en su banco comunal, ya que siempre le da alegría al resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles que requiere comprará más bebidas para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Nelida, 23 years old, knows that it is time to help with the household expenses. She lives in her parents’ home, and they helped her start her business. She is a very happy young woman and is concerned with getting ahead. For this reason she decided to open a liquor store with the help of her parents. The store is very busy because she sells her products at good prices. She likes her work and enjoys advising her customers on the best quality of liquor that they can buy. She would like to have a bigger store where she could sell all kinds of liquors, and in this way increase her income. She has been doing this work for two years and the most difficult part is getting the liquor because there are many counterfeit liquors and liquors of bad quality, so she must know how to differentiate them. This is the first loan that she has requested from Kiva partner MFP, and she wants to pay it on time as she plans to take out other loans in the future. She is well-loved at her communal bank because she always gives great joy to the rest of the members. With the 1,000 new soles loan she will buy more beverages to better stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina es socia del Banco Comunal Dos Mil.
Agustina es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Agustina venD. camote, manzanas, plátano, yuca, todos estos productos sancochados en el horno, sus ventas los realiza D. manera ambulatoria.
Agustina necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. camote, manzanas.
Los sueños D. Agustina son tener otro negocio y que sus hijos culminen sus estuD..
texts.en:
Agustina is a member of the Two Thousand Communal Bank. She is married, is 40 years old, and has 4 children. Agustina sells sweet potatoes, apples, plantains, manioc root as a street vendor, all of which are parboiled on the stove. Agustina needs a loan of 1,000 soles, money that she will invest in the purchase of sweet potatoes and apples. She dreams of having another business and that her children complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweet potatoes and apples

loans.name: Gladys Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Gladys  B. M., tiene la edad de 43 años, habita en el barrio los Martines ubicado en la concepción, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante de frutas y verduras en el M. Oriental, de la capital de Managua, ellos tienen a su cargo dos hijos los cuales estudian actualmente, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y algún día poder construir su casa ya que la que habitan actualmente es de madera , doña Gladys se dedica a la agricultura y al comercio desde hace diez años , la mayor dificultad que se le ha presentado durante este tiempo es la falta de financiamiento , ella inicio con sus propios esfuerzos , los planes hacia un futuro como productora es diversificar sus cultivos ; el financiamiento obtenido lo va a invertir en la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para aplicárselo a sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Señora Gladys B. M. is 43 and lives in the Los Martines neighborhood, which is located in La Concepción. She lives with her husband, who works selling fruits and vegetables in the eastern market in the capital of Managua. They have two children who are in school. Their plans for their family are to improve their living conditions and to someday construct a home since the one they live in now is made out of wood. Doña Gladys has been dedicated to agriculture and sales for ten years. The most difficult thing that she has faced during this time is the lack of financing. She started with her own money. Her plans for the future as a producer are to diversify her crops. She will invest this loan in the purchase of fertilizers and supplies to apply to her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies to improve her crops

loans.name: Adela Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol es socia del Banco Comunal Dos Mil.
Marisol es soltera, tiene 32 años y 1 hijo, estudia administración en la universidad, Marisol vende celulares, accesorios para celulares, recargas, tarjetas y servicio técnico, su negocio esta ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho en un local alquilado.
Marisol necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de accesorios para celulares.
Los sueños de Marisol son ampliar su negocio y culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Marisol is a member of the Two Thousand Communal Bank. She is 32 years old, single, has one son, and is studying administration at the university. Marisol sells cellular phones, accessories for cellular phones, chargers, phone cards, and technical service. Her business is located in the center of the city of Ayacucho in a rented space. Marisol needs a loan of 600 soles, money that she will invest in the purchase of cellular phone accessories. Marisol dreams of expanding her business and finishing her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cellular phone accessories

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Kuskanchik que significa Nosotros en quechua.
Elena es soltera, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Elena tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en donde vende menajes, utensilios de cocina, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Elena necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ollas, platos.
Los sueños de Elena son mejorar su negocio y tener un puesto propio.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the communal bank Kuskanchik, which means "Us" in Quechua. She is single, is 34, and has two children. She has a stand in the Nery García market where she sells household items and kitchen utensils. She acquires her products in the city of Lima. Elena needs a loan of 900 PEN, which she will invest in the purchase of pots and plates. Elena's dream is to improve her business and to have her own stand.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pots and plates

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Kuskanchik que significa Nosotros en quechua.
Victoria es soltera y tiene 48 años, Victoria vende cosméticos por catálogos y ropa a pedido que ofrece a amigos y familiares, además Victoria prepara humitas (pastel de maíz) de acuerdo a pedidos.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de desodorantes y colonias.
Victoria sueña con tener un cafetín en un local propio.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Kuskanchik communal bank, which means "Us" in Quechua. She is single and 48-years-old. She sells cosmetics by catalog and clothing to friends and family members. She also prepares humitas (a type of corn cake) by taking orders for them. Victoria needs a loan of 900 PEN, which she will invest in the purchase of deodorant and colognes. Victoria dreams about having a café in her own location.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy colognes and deodorant

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Kuskanchik que significa Nosotros en quechua.
Maria es casada, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Maria se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además Maria los días sábados viaja a las ferias a vender ropa.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa niños.
Los sueños de Maria son mejorar su negocio, surtir con mas productos y tener un puesto propio.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Kuskanchik communal bank, which means "Us" in Quechua. She is married, is 40-years-old, and has 2 children. She sells clothing as a street vendor in the Nery García market. She acquires her products in the city of Lima. On Saturdays, Maria travels to different markets to sell clothing. She needs a loan of 900 PEN, which she will invest in the purchase of children's clothing. Her dreams are to improve her business, to stock it with more products, and to have her own stand in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase children's clothing

loans.name: Angel Ricardo

texts.es: El señor Ángel Ricardo O. , tiene la edad de 30 años habita en el barrio San José de los Ríos , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como domestica para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar ya que ello tienen a su cargo dos hijos un varón de seis años y una niña de diez los pequeños actualmente estudian , los planes hacia su familia es poder construir dos cuartos para que sus hijos puedan vivir mas cómodos , don Ángel desde hace 10 años trabaja como agricultor , la mayor dificultad que se le ha presentado es la falta de financiamiento y los gases del volcán que le afectan la floración , el inicio como agricultor con el apoyo de su papá quien desde pequeños le enseño como trabajar las tierra , el financiamiento lo va a invertir en para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para obtener una cosecha mejor este año.
texts.en:
Señor Ángel Ricardo O. is 30-years-old and lives in the San José de los Ríos neighborhood. He lives with his wife, who works as a domestic employee to help him pay their home's expenses since they have two children: a 6-year-old boy and a 10-year-old girl. They are currently in school. Their plans for their family are to be able to construct two rooms so their children can live more comfortably. Don Ángel has worked in agriculture for 10 years. The most difficult thing he has faced is the lack of financing and the gases from the volcano, which affect the blooming period of his crops. He started as a farmer with the help of his father, who taught him how to work the land starting when he was young. He will invest this loan in the purchase of supplies and fertilizers so he can have a better harvest this year.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies to improve his production

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora Maria Elena Espinosa Pérez tiene la edad de 54 años, ella es madre soltera, el apoyo que ella obtiene es a través de su trabajo como modista y su única hija que trabaja le apoya con los gastos del hogar, los planes hacia su familia es poder terminar de construir su vivienda para que en un futuro puedan vivir cómodos, ya que a pesar de su edad a luchado mucho para poder hacer realidad el sueño de ver terminada su casa .Con el financiamiento va a comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar el techo de la terraza que esta en mal estado, da la gracias Afodenic por el apoyo que ha brindado a su familia para lograr sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Miss Maria Elena Espinosa Pérez is 54 years old and is a single mother. The support that she has received through her work as a dressmaker and through her only daughter that works with her, supports her with the expenses of her home. The plan for her family is to be able to finish constructing her home so that in the future they can live comfortably. In spite of her age, she has fought hard to be able to make her dream a reality of seeing her house finished.

With this financing, she is going to buy construction materials to improve her terrace roof, which is in bad condition. She gives thanks to Afodenic for the support that that they have provided to her family to achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Sattin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to repair her terrace roof

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana de 44 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con una de sus 3 hijas. Se dedica a la costura desde hace 2 años atrás, a razón de haber aprendido empíricamente cuando le apoyaba a su madre, quien era una de las mejores costureras en sus tiempos. Ana solo cose ropa para damas y niños, y esta labor la realiza en las instalaciones de su casa, contando con el apoyo de su hija, quien se encarga de hacer los cortes de las telas. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar lo mejor de ella para que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos, y le es rentable porque aparte de brindar sus servicios de costura a personas particulares, también confecciona ropa para llevar a vender. La señora Ana es muy activa puesto que también vende productos de belleza por catálogo y le va muy bien. Al momento tiene 2 préstamos con MFP, en estos tiempos están habiendo problemas en su banco comunal porque algunos de sus integrante no asisten a las reuniones, pero Ana se mantiene firme en su responsabilidad con sus pagos. Invertirá la cantidad que solicita en la compra de materiales de costura y productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Ana is 44 years old, is a single mother and lives with her 3 daughters. She has been a seamstress for the past 2 years, which she had learned empirically when she was supporting her mother, who was one of the best seamstresses of her time. Ana only sews clothing for women and children. She has set up her work in an installation of her house, counting on the support of her daughter, who is in charge of making the cuts of fabric.

What she likes about her work is giving the best of herself so that her customers feel satisfied. It is profitable to her because, apart from providing her sewing services to particular people, she also makes clothing to sell. Miss Ana is very active given that she also sells beauty products for catalogs, which is going very well for her.

At the moment, she has 2 loans with MFP. At this time they are having problems within the communal bank because some of its members don’t attend the meetings, but Ana remains firm in her responsibility with her payments. She will invest the amount she is requesting in the purchase of sewing materials and beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Sattin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sewing materials and beauty products

loans.name: Elisa Marcela

texts.es:
La microempresaria Elisa Marcela O. López tiene 54 años de edad, es madre soltera con 6 hijos todos mayores de edad, se dedica desde hace 35 años a la venta de verduras en el mercado municipal de esta ciudad de Bluefields. Para realizar esta actividad viaja a la capital en donde compra dicha verdura a precios más baratos.

Con esta actividad ha podido darles educación y salud a todos sus hijos quienes actualmente le ayudan en el negocio aunque viven en sus propias viviendas. Esta microempresaria ya ha sido beneficiada con dos créditos anteriormente con kiva el primero de US 350 y el segundo de US 500, ambos los ha pagado en tiempo y forma. En los dos casos los préstamos han sido para la compra de verduras en mayores cantidades con el fin de obtener mayores ganancias.

En esta ocasión esta solicitando el financiamiento de US 600 dólares los cuales los invertirá de la siguiente manera:

4 quintales de Papas a US$ 35 cada quintal,  4 quintales de cebollas a US$ 35 cada quintal, 5 quintales de repollo a US$ 20 cada quintal, 4 cajas de  tomates a US$ 15 cada caja, 2 quintales de zanahorias a US$ 35 cada quintal y 30 sacos carbón a US$ 3 cada saco.
texts.en:
Microentreprenuer Elisa Marcela O. López is 54. She is a single mother of 6 grown children. She has been selling vegetables in the municipal market in the city of Bluefields for 35 years. To make her business possible, she travels to the capital where she can buy vegetables at a lower price. With this business she has been able keep her children healthy and give them an education. Even though they live in their own homes, they help her with the business. This microentreprenuer has had two previous loans with Kiva. The first was for $350, and the second was for $500. Both have been repaid on time and as agreed upon. In each case the loan was used to buy larger quantities of vegetables to increase her earnings. This time she is asking for a loan of $600 which she will use in the following manner: 4 quintales of potatoes @ $35 per quintal (1 quintal = 46 kg) , 4 quintales of onions @ $35 per quintal, 5 quintales of cabbage @ $20 per quintal, 4 boxes of tomatoes @$15 per box, 2 quintales of carrots @$35 per quintal and 30 bags of charcoal @ $3 per bag.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Buy: Vegetables (potatoes, onions, cabbage, tomatoes and carrots) and charcoal.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 47 años de edad, vive con su esposo, ya que sus hijos son mayores de edad e independientes y de familia. Se dedica a la venta de ropa para adultos y niños, estas prendas las lleva a vender por las distintas calles de donde vive. En esta actividad ya lleva dos años y le va muy bien, ya que no tiene carga familiar y solo vela por sus gastos personales. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares y se relaciona e intercambia ideas con sus clientes. Además le es rentable porque vende a diario y trabaja solo con pedidos. Posteriormente, le gustaría abrir una tienda de ropa. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque existe compañerismo entre sus integrantes. Con el dinero que está solicitando incrementará su mercadería.
texts.en:
Carmen, 47, lives with her husband. Her children are grown, independent and have their own families. She sells clothing for adults and children. She takes these garments to sell on the different streets where she lives. She has been doing this for two years, and it is going very well. Now that she does not have the expenses of the children, she works for her personal expenses. What she likes about her work is that she knows many places; she connects and exchanges ideas with her customers. It is profitable because she sells every day and works only with custom orders. Later, she would like to open a clothing store. This is the first loan with MFP. She likes to work with her community bank because of the companionship within the membership. With this loan she will increase her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es: Casilda de 49 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con sus tres hijos y nietos que la apoyan mucho. Se dedica a la venta de comida, vende desayunos y almuerzos, que complementa con la venta de bebidas gasificadas. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 6 años en las instalaciones de su casa y cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque la hace sentir útil, además le es rentable porque se encuentra ubicada en un sitio estratégico (paradero de autos de transporte). Para más adelante, Casilda quiere llegar a ampliar su negocio y constituir un restaurante. Con MFP ya tiene 8 préstamos, y le encanta trabajar con su banco comunal porque hay comprensión entre todos los integrantes. Invertirá 1500 soles en su negocio de la venta de comida y bebidas, y lo demás es para apoyar en los gastos a su hijo quien está estudiando una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Casilda is 49, is a single mother, and lives with her three children and grandchildren who support her a lot. She sells food, including breakfast and lunch, which she complements by selling soft drinks. She has done this for six years in her home, and she has the help of her children. She likes her job a lot because it makes her feel useful. It is also profitable because her business is located in a strategic place (at a taxi stand). In the future, Casilda wants to expand her business and have a restaurant. She has had eight loans with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she loves to work with her communal bank because there is an understanding among all of the members. She will invest 1500 PEN in selling food and drinks, and the rest she will use to support the educational expenses of her son, who is studying to be a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in capital for her business

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora tiene 59 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con sus 2 hijas, en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y bebidas en un espacio que implementó frente a su casa. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 6 años y cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijas. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce a muchas personas a quienes le brinda la atención y confianza necesaria, además le es rentable porque sus productos se venden a diario y le genera buenos ingresos, ya que por su zona es la única persona con este tipo de negocio. El sueño de Dora, para el futuro, es tener un minimarket. Con MFP viene accediendo a 8 préstamos, a ella le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque los integrantes son cumplidos con su pago y no tienen problemas de mora. El dinero que solicita en esta oportunidad lo invertirá en su pequeña bodega, comprando productos de primera necesidad y bebidas gaseosas.
texts.en:
Dora is 59, is a single mother, and lives with her two daughters in her own home. She sells basic goods and drinks in a space she fixed up in her home. She has had this business for six years and has the support of her daughters. What she likes about her job is meeting a lot of people to whom she offers service. Her business is also profitable because she sells her products daily and generates good income because she is the only person in her area with this type of business. Dora's dream for the future is to have a mini-market. This is her eighth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She likes working with her communal bank because the members are responsible with their payments and don't have problems with being late. She will invest the money she is requesting in her small store and will buy basic goods and soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria de 24 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos pequeños en edad escolar. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad ocupando un espacio que implemento al frente de su casa. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 3 años, y es la fuente de ingresos que complementa el trabajo de su esposo, para el sustento de ella y de sus hijos, a quienes les brinda lo necesario para sus estudios. A Gloria le agrada mucho su trabajo, ya que gracias al mismo y su carisma al atender, cuenta con una gran clientela. Esta es la primera vez que viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, además le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque le hay mucha confianza y comunicación entre todos sus integrantes, lo que facilita su trabajo de grupo, y su buen desempeño ante su asesora de crédito. Gloria invertirá el dinero en la compra de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Gloria is a 24-year-old married mother of two school-age children. She sells groceries and staple items from a space in the front of her house. She has had the shop for three years, and it is already a good source of income. Gloria's earnings, coupled with those of her husband, cover their household expenses and provide for the education of their children. Gloria really enjoys her work, and thanks to her charm and customer service, she has a very large clientele.

This is Gloria's first loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA. She has enjoyed working with her community bank because there is much trust and communication among the members, which facilitates the functioning of the group and assures their good evaluation from their loan advisor.

Gloria will invest this loan in the purchase of groceries and staple goods.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Marta Iris

texts.es:
La microempresaria Marta Iris O. Guzmán tiene 42 años de edad, es casada con 4 hijos, dos mayores de edad y dos menores todos estudian en niveles de primaria y secundaria. Doña Marta se dedica desde hace 20 años a la venta de lácteos (Queso, crema y mantequilla) en el mercado municipal de esta ciudad de Bluefields.

Para este negocio la señora O. es abastecida por comerciantes originarios de otras regiones del país, sin embargo la ganancia que obtiene es mínima ya que sus abastecedores son intermediarios, por lo que ella pretende viajar a comprar directamente con los productores de lácteos y de esta forma obtener los productos a mas bajo costo.

Esta microempresaria ya ha sido beneficiada anteriormente con dos créditos por parte de los prestamistas de Kiva y manifiesta que le han servido para poder ir mejorando tanto en su negocio como en su vida personal.

Esta solicitando se le financie para comprar:

2 quintales de Queso los que compra a US 110 cada quintal, 150 libras de crema a US 0.90 cada libra, 125 libras de mantequilla a US 1 cada libra y 1 quintal de queso-crema el que compra a US 120 el quintal.

Se debe aclarar que en la fotografia aparece el señor Margarito Torres quien es el esposo de doña Marta O., ya que esta se encuentra un poco indispuesta de salud y no podia estar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Marta Iris O. Guzmán is a 42-year-old, married, small businessperson. She has four children, two who are already grown, one in primary school, and one in secondary school. For the last twenty years, Marta has sold dairy products (cheese, cream, and butter) in the municipal market of the city of Bluefields.

The products necessary for Mrs. O.'s business are provided by suppliers from other regions of the country. As the suppliers are intermediaries, Marta's profits are minimal. So, she hopes to go purchase supplies directly from the producers and in this way obtain their products at a lower cost.

This small business has already been the beneficiary of two prior loans from Kiva lenders, and Marta attests that this support has enabled her to improve both her business and her personal life.

She is requesting funding to purchase: 200 pounds of cheese (to be purchased for US $220), 150 pounds of cream (at US $0.90 per pound), 125 pounds of butter (at US $1.00 per pound), and 100 pounds of cream cheese (to be purchased for US $120).

Please note that the photo above is of Marta's husband Margarito Torres, as Marta was sick the day the photo was taken and was not able to be at her place of business.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dairy products (cheese, cream, and butter)

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa M., 50, is married with 5 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public and villagers 4 days per week. 

She has 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~180 USD).  SPBD loans are Rosa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy necessary materials for her business.

loans.use: Purchase goods for the shop such as snacks, canned food, sweets and frozen food.

loans.name: Luana

texts.en:
Luana S., 39, is married with 4 children. She has 2 years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the villagers/general public 6 days per week.

She has 3 previous loan(s) with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~130 USD). SPBD loans are Luana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy materials needed for the business.

loans.use: Buy new sewing machine, cotton fabric, threads and needles.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita N. F., 55, is married with 5 children. She has 3 years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the villagers/general public 6 days per week.

She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~200 USD). SPBD loans are Rita’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to buy materials for her sewing business and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: Buy new sewing machine, cotton fabrics and threads. Also help pay children's school fees.

loans.name: Faamomoi

texts.en:
Faamomoi S., 45, is married with 4 children. She has 2 years of experience in the pork cake business. She sells to the general public/villagers 4 days per week.

She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD). SPBD loans are Faamomoi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to buy materials needed for the business.

loans.use: Buy sacks of flour, baking powder, soy sauce, yeast and large pots.

loans.name: Saili

texts.en:
Saili F., 27, is married with 3 children. She has 2 years of experience in the fishing business. She sells fish to the general public/villagers 5 days per week.

She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~160 USD). SPBD loans are Saili’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to buy material needed for the business only.

loans.use: To buy fishing net and a new fishing canoe

loans.name: Paraska

texts.en:
Paraska C. has a barber shop in Beregovo city. Paraska has been in this business for 15 years. Her profit is 2,500 UAH per month. Paraska just loves her business. She treats customers with love and care and has many repeated customers.

Paraska would like to get a loan of 3,500 UAH to remodel and fix her barber shop. This will help her to attract even more customers and increase her income.

loans.use: To remodel her barber shop

loans.name: Paupau

texts.en: Paupau T., 23, is married with two children.  She has one year of experience in the Pancake business. She sells to the general public, villagers and school children four days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala.  SPBD loans are Paupau’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will mainly be used to buy things for her pancake business.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients such as sacks of sugar, flour, baking powder, etc.

loans.name: Litia

texts.en: Litia F., 46, is married with three children.  She has many years of experience in men and women's outfit design business. She sells to the villagers and public seven days per week. She has three previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala. SPBD loans are Litia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All her loan will be used to fund things needed for the business.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, materials and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Mereane

texts.en: Mereane S., 39, is married with five children.  She has many years of experience in the Plantation business. She sells to the villagers and public seven days per week. She has three previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala. SPBD loans are Mereane’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used on her business and also to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers, chemicals, knives and to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia S., 45, is married with 10 children.  She has many years of experience in the grocery business. She sells to the villagers and public seven days per week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala.  SPBD loans are Asia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to buy goods for the shop.

loans.use: Purchase snack foods, canned food and frozen foods.

loans.name: Jokudu

texts.en:
Jokudu K. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to buy and stock more charcoal for sale. Jokudu is 45 years old and married to a pastor. She has six children and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy and stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona A. is currently in the business of selling small commodities like toothpaste, etc. at the shop and is requesting a loan to buy a fridge to be used in the shop for cooling soft drinks. Lona is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a clerk. She has three children, all of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Lona also hopes to be able to buy a bus to transport passengers from town to town. 
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a wide range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy a fridge to cool soft drinks sold in the shop

loans.name: Puruza

texts.en:
Puruza was born in 1956.  She is married and has four children.  Puruza is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan.  She settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Mahmudlu-2 village. 
Puruza has been in the dairy business for four years.  She needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy two cows to improve her dairy business.

loans.use: Buy 2 cows.

loans.name: Aladdin

texts.en: Aladdin was born in 1977.  He is married and has three children.  Aladdin is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan.  He settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Alikhanli village.  Three years ago he started a sheep breeding business.  Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 15 sheep to improve his sheep breeding business.

loans.use: Buy 15 sheep

loans.name: Babayeva

texts.en: V. is a mother of three children.  She has been in the farming business for five years.  V. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan.  She settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Seyidahmadli village.  Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to  buy fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides to improve her farming business.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides.

loans.name: Murvat

texts.en: Murvat is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan.  He has settled in the Fuzuli region, in Alikhanli village.  He was born in 1965, is married and has four children.  Murvat has been in the taxi business for seven years.  Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy spare parts to improve his taxi business.

loans.use: Buy spare parts.

loans.name: Enoe De La Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Enoe de la Concepción Hernández,  tiene la edad de 36 años habita en el barrio la Francia numero dos, junto sus dos hijos, ella es madre soltera, los planes hacia un futuro es brindarle mejor condición de vida a sus pequeños, la actividad de ella es el comercio y la agricultura desde hace ocho años  como agricultura y diez como comerciante, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , los planes hacia un futuro en su cultivos es poder diversificarlo para obtener mejores ingresos y poder comprar un terreno y trabajarlo . El financiamiento lo quiere  para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para tener una cosecha buena.
texts.en:
Enoe de la Concepción Hernández is a 36-year-old single mother who lives with her two children in the “Francia Number 2” neighborhood. Her dream for the future is to provide a better standard of living for her children.

Enoe is a shopkeeper and a farmer. She has worked in agriculture for eight years and in business for ten. The biggest difficulty she faces is a lack of funding. In the future, she would like to diversify her crops to increase her income. She would also like to buy a plot of land to farm.

She is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizers and supplies to ensure a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase farming supplies for a good harvest

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: El señor Luís Alfonso C., tiene la edad de 53 años, habita el barrio Ervin  Ruiz ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa, la cual tiene un tramo de verduras y frutas en el mercado Oriental, ello tienen siete hijos, cinco de ellos ya son casados y dos tienen a su cargo, uno de 15 años que estudia y le apoya con los trabajos agrícola y la niña de 13 años estudia , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones y darle estudio para que puedan sacar una carrera y no pasen las dificultades que han tenido . Don Luís desde hace 26 años se dedica a la agricultura, la mayor necesidad es la falta de financiamiento, el inicio esta actividad por su padres, los planes futuros hacia sus cultivos es establecer mas para poder hacer una casa. Con el financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para poder tener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Luís Alfonso C. is 53 years old and lives with his wife in the Ervin Ruiz neighborhood of Ticuantepe. His wife has a fruit and vegetable stand in the Oriental market. They have seven children, five of whom are already married, and two who are still dependent on them. His 15-year-old son is a student and also helps with farming chores. His 13-year-old daughter is a student. His dream for the future is to improve the standard of living of his family and to provide for his children's education so that they can be professionals and not have to go through the difficulties that he has experienced.

For 26 years, Luís has been a farmer, work passed in to him by his parents. The greatest difficulty he has faced is a lack of funding. In the future, he would like to produce more crops so that he can earn enough to build a house.

With this loan, Luís will purchase fertilizers and supplies to ensure a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for a better harvest

loans.name: Rita Esmeralda

texts.es: La señora Rita Esmeralda Martines tiene la edad de 31 años habita en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla en la ciudad de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo , el cual trabaja como albañil para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar ; ellos tienen a su cargo dos hijos una niña de 12 años y un varón de 8 años los dos estudian su primaria , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , ya que ellos tienen planes de hacer las divisiones de su vivienda , ella solicita un financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción  y poder tener mejor privacidad ya que divide su cuarto con una sabana y lo que mas desea es poder dar a sus hijos una casa digna.
texts.en:
Rita Esmeralda Martines is 31 years old and lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla neighborhood of Ticuantepe. She lives with her husband, who works as a bricklayer to pay for their household expenses. They have a 12-year-old daughter and an 8-year-old son, both of whom are in primary school.

Rita's dream is to improve her family's living conditions. She would like to make partitions in her living space, as currently the “rooms” of her house are separated merely by sheets. So, she is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials so that she can have more privacy. More than anything, she wants to provide her children a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to partition a room

loans.name: Lucia Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita tiene 43 años de edad, reside en Laureles Sur en la ciudad de Managua, con cinco hijos de 3, 12, 20,22 y 23 años de edad,  los tres menores estudian, su esposo es electricista, su negocio es un bar. En un colegio en donde vende comida, golosinas, gaseosa, y otros productos, desde horas muy tempranas sale de su casa ya que desde muy tempranos los alumnos llegan a comprar al bar., tiene cinco años administrando este local. El crédito lo va a invertir en comprar zinc y perlines  para cambiar el techo de su casa ya que esta en mal estado y no desea mojarse en este invierno. Este es su séptimo ciclo en Afodenic y da las gracias por los beneficios de poder hacer posible las mejoras de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Margarita is 43 years old and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood of Managua. She lives with her five children (ages 3, 12, 20, 22, and 23). Her three youngest children are still in school. Her husband is an electrician. For five years she has had a café in a local high school, where she sells food, sweets, soft drinks, and other items. She must leave the house very early in the morning since the students arrive early at the café.

She will use this loan to purchase zinc paneling and beams to replace the roof of her house, which needs to be fixed so that it doesn't leak this winter. This is her seventh loan from AFODENIC, and she is grateful for the support that has enabled her to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to replace the roof of her home.

loans.name: Usmonboy

texts.ru: Усмонбою исполнилось 20 лет, еще не женат и проживает с родителями. После окончания школы сразу начал заниматься бизнесом на местных рынках. Он покупает и продает сухофрукты. Первый капитал для расширения своей деятельности получил от своего отца, который помог ему освоить этот нелегкий бизнес. Узнав о МикроИнвест, Усмонбой решил попробовать получив займ и поработать с ним. На полученный займ собирается закупить компотную смесь, на которую имеет заказ
texts.en:
Usmonboy has turned 20, he is not married yet and lives with parents. After graduation from school he has started his own business selling on the local markets. He buys and sells dry fruits. He got his first capital for start up and expansion of business from his father who helped him learn this somewhat difficult business. When Usmonboy found out about MicroInvest he decided to try to get a loan and work with it. He will use the loan to buy compote mixture for which he already has an order.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Azizahon

texts.ru: Азизахон замужем, ей 32 года, имеет 2 детей. Муж на заработках в России. Азизахон стала заниматься бизнесом уже несколько лет назад. Она любит свое занятие, так как это помогает ей содержать ее семью. Это очень дружная семья и каждые 2-3 дня Азизахон и ее дети разговаривают со своим отцом в России по телефону. На займ который Азизахон собирается получить она хочет расширить свой бизнес и приобрести новый ассортимент одежды.
texts.en:
Azizahon is married, she is 32 years old and has two children. Her husband is a laborer in Russia. Azizahon started her business several years ago. She loves what she does because this helps her to sustain her family. They are a very close family and every two or three days Azizahon and her children talk on the phone with their father in Russia. Azizahon will use the loan to expand her business and purchase a new assortment of clothing.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехра и ее муж уже несколько лет занимаются предпринимательством. В регионе, где они живут, нет постоянного места работы. Доход от предпринимательства является основным доходом их семьи. Гульчехре 44 года, имеет 4 детей. Она собирается расширить свой бизнес, и так как уже в течении 1,5 лет является активной клиенткой МикроИнвест то решила подать новую заявку на займ.
texts.en:
Gulchehra and her husband have been small business entrepreneurs for several years. There are no permanent employment opportunities in the region where they live. The business provides the family's primary source of income. Gulchehra is 44 years old and has 4 children. She plans to expand her business and has been a client of Microinvest for the past year and a half, so she is submitting an application for a new loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Исмоил и его жена проживают в сельской местности. Основной работой является работа в колхозе. Исмоилу 56 лет, у него 6 детей. В летний период Исмоил кроме работы по вечерам занимается заготовкой сена для своего домашнего скота. Его жена дома смотрит за скотиной и это занятие приносит дополнительный доход в семью. Исмоил активный клиент МикроИнвест уже год. Займы использует для покупки молодых бычков и в течении 2-3 месяцев продает. Новый займ собирается также употребить на покупку 1 бычка.
texts.en:
Ismoil and his wife live in a rural area. His primary work is on a collective farm. Ismoil is 56 years old and has 6 children. During the summer in addition to his usual work he spends evenings gathering hay to store for his livestock. The livestock are cared for by his wife, and they provide additional income for the family. Ismoil has been an active client of Microinvest for a year. He has used loans to buy young bull calves, which he sells after 2-3 months. He plans to use a new loan for the same use, purchase of a calf.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a bull calf

loans.name: Abdullochon

texts.ru: Абдуллочону 59 лет, женат и воспитывает  6 детей. Основной его работой является выращивание скота дома. Ему помогают его старшие дети и его жена.  Кроме крупнорогатого скота выращивает коз, шерсть которых весной стрижет и продает. От коров получает молоко, которое часть употребляет в семь, а излишки продает и на полученный доход покупает комбикорм. Абдуллочон подал заявку на займ, так как планирует отремонтировать крышу коровника и прикупить сено.
texts.en:
Abdullochon is 59 years years old, married, and has 6 children. Raising livestock at home is his primary employment, and his wife and son help as well. Beside cattle he also raises goats, whose wool he shears and sells in the spring. Milk from the cows is used partly by the family; the surplus is sold and the profit used to buy animal feed. Abdullochon applied for a loan to repair the roof of the dairy shed and buy hay.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof repair and hay purchase

loans.name: Umar

texts.ru: Умар и его жена работают в колхозе. Ему 44 года, имеет 2 детей. Дома имеют домашний скот и кроме этого, Умар занимается куплей продажей скота на местных рынках. Доход от купли продажи скота и излишки молока, которые жена Умара продает, дополняют и без того скудный бюджет семьи. Умар подал заявку на получение займа на КИВА и собирается прикупить корм для скота и прикупить маленького бычка.
texts.en:
Umar and his wife work on a collective farm. He is 44 years old and has two children. They have domestic livestock at home, and Umar also trades livestock at local markets. Income from sale of animals and surplus milk which Umar's wife sells supplement the family budget, which would otherwise be very tight. Umar applied to Kiva for a loan to buy livestock feed and a young bull calf.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchase of feed and one bull calf

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru: Каромат имеет 6 детей. Старшие сыновья находятся в России, и каждый месяц присылают денег для содержания семей. Сама Каромат нигде не работает, но при этом сидит дома и воспитывает своих внуков. Каромат узнала, что МикроИнвест выдает потребительские займы, и решила получить информацию у кредитных специалистов этой организации. Условия кредитования ей понравились, и она решила подать заявку на получение потребительского займа. Она собирается потратить его на ремонт своего дома.
texts.en:
Karomat has six children. The oldest sons are in Russia, and send back money monthly to support the family. Karomat herself is unemployed; she stays at home and raises her grandchildren. Karomat found out that Microinvest gives consumer loans and decided to request information from the organization's credit specialists. The conditions and terms seemed fair and she decided to apply for a consumer loan. She plans to use it for repairs to her home.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House repairs

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga B. is married with two grown-up children. She has had a retail business for ten years, selling food at a department store in the city of Vasilyevka. Olga is hard-working and has been able to develop her business in three different locations. Her approach is to serve her customers well.

Olga would like a loan of 3000 UAH to increase the assortment of products she offers. She wants to increase her sales so that she can help her son and daughter financially.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of products

loans.name: Betty Janeth

texts.es: Betty Janeth A. C. vive en San Salvador capital de El Salvador, es madre soltera de tres hijos entre ellos dos niñas de 23 y 16 años de edad y el niño de 9 años de edad, dos de ellos aun siguen en la escuela y su hija de 23 años que ya se graduó de el bachillerato, pero por motivos económicos se ve forzada a trabajar y dejar a un lado el sueño de poder ir a la universidad, Betty se dedica  a su negocio que está ubicado dentro de su misma casa, es un pequeño taller de costura donde se elaboran todo tipo de vestidos y ropa a la medida del cliente, Betty esta solicitando este crédito por que quiere comprar una maquina mas;  para poder aumentar su producción en la costura, de esta manera sacara mas producción que le ayudara aumentar los ingresos en el negocio.
texts.en:
Betty Janeth A. C. lives in the capital of El Salvador, San Salvador, and is a single mother to three children. She has two girls (ages 23 and 16) and one boy (age 9). Her two youngest children are still in school. Her 23-year-old daughter graduated from high school, but because of the lack of economic resources she has had to put aside her dream of going to college and instead has found a job.

Betty has a small sewing shop in her home, where she makes dresses and all kinds of custom-tailored clothing. Betty is requesting a loan because she wants to buy another sewing machine so that she can increase her production which will help her increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Juana Del Socorro

texts.es: Juana del Socorro S. D. S. vive en Soyapango departamento San Salvador, es una mujer casada que con su negocio aporta económicamente a su familia. Juana posee una tienda dentro D. su casa, que es la preferida por vecinos en la zona ya que la Sra. es muy amable con sus clientes, es por ello el éxito  su negocio.  Juana anteriormente ya ha obtenido créditos, donD. sus pagos han sido muy puntuales, pero hoy Juana quiere un nuevo crédito para invertir en su negocio surtiéndolo D. otros productos que sus fieles clientes le solicitan.
texts.en:
Juana del Socorro S. D. S. lives in Sayopango, a district in San Salvador. She is a married woman and she supports her family with the help of her business. Juana runs a store from her house, and it is the favored store among her neighbours because she is very kind to them, and it is why her business is such a success. Juana has had loans previously and her payments have been very punctual. But Juana requires a new loan to invest in her business, to restock with other products that her loyal clients have asked of her.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To restock her store.

loans.name: Estela Ariday

texts.es: Estela Ariday M. O., vive en Soyapango departamento San Salvador, tiene 57 años de edad, tiene tres hijos pero solo uno de ellos vive con ella;  es una hija de 23 años de edad con un nivel educativo de bachillerato y actualmente solo trabaja, La Sra. Estela ha sacado a sus hijos adelante con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo y no se cansa en la lucha; ya que sigue al pie en su negocio, que una pequeña tienda ubicada en su casa, donde tiene muchos clientes; ya que está en una zona muy popular donde hay mucha afluencia de transporte público, la Sra. Estela ha tenido créditos con Integral y ha sido muy puntual en su pagos. Ahora solicita un nuevo crédito para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Estela Ariday M. O. lives in the Soyapango of San Salvador. She is 57 years old and she has three children, only one of whom still lives with her - her daughter is 23 years old and she has completed high school but currently she is working. Estela has supported her children with a great deal of effort and hard work, but she does not tire in her struggle. She continues to run her business, a small store located in her house, where she accomodates many clients. It is a very popular spot where it is well travelled by the public. Estela has had loans in the past with Integral (Kiva Field Partner) and she has been very timely with her paymetns. She is requesting a new loan to restock her store.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maura Del Carmen

texts.es: Maura del Carmen P. M. vive en Soyapango departamento San Salvador. Tiene 39 años de edad, vive con sus  dos hijos, una niña de 16 años de edad y un niño de 11 años de edad ambos estudian. Maura es una mujer muy trabajadora ha sabido asumir los gastos de la familia y las responsabilidades como madre soltera, ella ha logrado establecer un negocio de venta de comida a las personas que trabajan en la zona, Maura tiene un clientela muy solida ya que sus precios son muy accesibles, pero ahora ella solicita un crédito por que quiere invertir en bebidas como gaseosas y jugos para tener variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maura del Carmen P. Marroquin lives in the Soyapango district of San Salvador. She is 39 years old and lives with her two children, a 16-year old girl and and 11-year old boy, both of whom are in school. Maura is a very hard working woman and she has always managed to cover the family's expenses and meet the responsibilities of a single mother. She has managed to establish her catering business aimed at the region's workers. Maura has a very solid clientele especially because her prices are so affordable. She is requesting a loan so that she might invest it in soft drink and juices to add selection to the products she can offer her clients.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products for her business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna T., 35, owns a sari-sari store. A sari-sari store in the Philippines is a retail store where you can buy assorted goods. With her little sari-sari store, she is able to send her three children to school and meet the daily needs of the family.

Myrna resides at Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to have additional capital for her business.

loans.use: additional capital for sari-sari store

location.town: Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Merlyn M.'s family's main source of income comes from fishing and rice fields. She also has a secondary business which is a sari-sari store located at their home. Increased rice production is her goal, which is behind her request for a loan of 15,000 PHP for fertilizer.

Mrs. Merlyn is 45 years of age, married to Mr. Romeo M., and blessed with three children. They presently reside at Polo Pitogo, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She has been a member in good standing of PDP-LP, Paglaum MPC, since 2000 and has established good business credentials.

Mrs. Merlyn has so many dreams for her family! She wants to increase her rice harvest and to turn her sari-sari store into a mini-grocery. She also wants a concrete house. But, most importantly, she wants her children to finish their studies and to become professionals someday.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for farming

location.town: Polo Pitogo, Bato, Plaridel, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong T., 32, lives in Siem Reap Province with her elderly mother. She is a single woman who earns a living planting vegetables on her farm in the village. She also owns a small rice mill machine, which she uses to supplement her income by providing a milling service to village farmers. Her mother assists with her business operations. Their investments are running smoothly and they have a good income; they earn about $8/day. Since the rice harvesting season is coming, Kong T. is seeking a $1200 loan to order rice stock, which she will hull and sell to market retailers for a profit.

loans.use: To order rice to stocks for hulling

loans.name: Ni Nengah Karsini

texts.id:
Setelah berjalan 6 bulan, kini Ni Nengah Karsini sudah menyelesaikan pinjamannya di DINARI untuk tahap yang pertama. Pinjaman tersebut dipergunakan untuk membeli induk babi dan pakan. Dari pinjaman yang pertama Ni Nengah Karsini kini memiliki 1 ekor induk babi. Dari 1 ekor induk babi ini Ni Nengah Karsini mendapatkan 8 ekor anak babi yang baru berusia kira - kira 17 hari. Anak babi ini baru bisa dijual jika sudah berumur kurang lebih 30 hari.
