Dari 1 ekor anak babi ini Ni Nengah Karsini bisa mendapatkan keuntungan kurang lebih Rp. 50.000,- Jadi dari 8 ekor anak babi yang Ni Nengah Karsini miliki, nantinya Dia akan memperoleh keuntungan Rp. 400.000,-
Ni Nengah Karsini berniat menambah induk babinya. Namun modal yang Dia punya belum mencukupi harga 1 ekor induk babi. Untuk itu Ni Nengah Karsini mengikuti program ternak babi yang ada di DINARI lagi. Pinjaman kedua ini dipergunakan untuk membeli induk babi, agar hasil yang Dia peroleh dari memelihara induk babi ini semakin besar. Ni Nengah Karsini juga berharap dapat terus membantu suaminya memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya.
texts.en:
Ni Nengah Karsini completed her 1st loan with Dinari in a 6 month period. She used the loan to buy breeding pig and pig feed. This breeding pig produced 8 piglets. They are around 2 weeks old at the moment. She will be able to sell these piglet when they are one month old. She can earn a profit of USD 4.4 / piglet, so in total she will earn USD 35.2.

Ni Nengah Karsini is planning to buy another breeding pig, therefore she is participating in another Dinari loan program. She is hoping to earn more money with 2 breeding pigs so she can help the family's economy.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy a breeding pig

loans.name: Ni Nengah Tarmin

texts.id: Enam bulan yang lalu Ni Nengah Tarmin mengikuti program  ternak babi yang ada Dinari. Awalnya Ni Nengah Tarmin berencana menggunakan uang pinjaman tersebut untuk membeli indu dan anak babi. Namun karna induk babi harganya cukup mahal, jadi Ni Nengah Tarmin menggunakannya untuk membeli anak babi saja. Di periode pertama Ni Nengah Tarmin mendapat keuntungan yang cukup banyak. Oleh karena itu kini Ni Nengah Tarmin mengajukan pinjaman kedua untuk menambah modalnya membeli anak babi. Ni Nengah Tarmin berharap melalui pinjaman kedua ini, Dia dapat membeli anak babi yang lebih banyak lagi. Sehingga pada saat panen nanti, Dia dapat memperoleh keuntungan yang lebih besar lagi.
texts.en:
Six months ago Ni Nengah Tarmin participated in the Dinari pig farming program. Initially she was planning to use the loan money to buy a breeding pig and several piglets. However due to the breeding pig was expensive, she then used the money to buy only the piglets.

With this Dinari program, Ni Nengah Tarmin was able to earn a considerable amount of profit. Therefore she wants to participate in a second Dinari loan program. This time she wants to buy more piglets so she can earn more profit.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig foods

loans.name: Ni Nengah Wiratna

texts.id: Tidak terasa waktu sudah berlalu. Enam bulan sudah Ni Nengah Wiratna bergabung dengan program ternak babi yang ada di Dinari. Selama eman bulan ini, Ni Nengah Wiratna sudah dua kali panen babi. Karena Ni Nengah Wiratna memelihara babinya hanya tiga bulan, lalu dijual. Dari dua kali panen ini,  Wiratna mendapatkan hasil yang lumayan. Kini Wiratna mengajukan pinjaman lagi untuk menambah modal usahanya. Kini Wiratna baru mempunyai 3 ekor babi penggemukan. Rencananya Dia akan menambah beberapa ekor lagi dari uang pinjaman yang diberikan Kiva melalui Yayasan Dinari. Dengan harapan usahanya memelihara pengemukan babi guling ini dapat berkembang. Sehingga Dia dapat membantu suaminya memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Terlebih lagi kebutuhan gizi anaknya yang baru berusia 1 tahun.
texts.en:
Ni Nengah Wiratna participated in Dinari pig farming program six months ago. During that period she was able to harvest her piglets twice. She earned a considerable amount of profit from this business.

At the moment she still has 3 piglets. She is planning to participate in her 2nd Dinari loan program so she buy more piglets to raise.

She is hoping to earn more money she can help her family's economy, in particular to ensure enough money to buy nutritious food to raise her one year old baby.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig foods

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok M., 49, and his wife, Ong Sophat, 47, live with their four children in the Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. They earn a living by selling chickens in the local market. This is their second loan from Kiva, and they will use the loan to expand their business and run a new business of selling children’s shoes. Their first loan from Kiva was used for buying more chickens for sale, and that loan had helped them increase their daily income to over $10 and support their family’s food needs adequately.

loans.use: To expand their business and to start a new business of selling children's shoes

loans.name: Ni Ketut Tiyarmini

texts.id: Pada periode pertama, Ni Ketut Tiyarmini menggunakan uang hasil pinjaman dari Dinari untuk memperbaiki kandang babinya. Kemudian sisanya digunakan untuk membeli pakan babi peliharaannya. Kini kandang babi Ni Ketut Tiyarmini sudah bagus. Di kandang tersebut awalnya Tiyarmini hanya memelihara 2 ekor babi penggemukan. Pada saat panen, Tiyarmini mendapatkan keuntungan kurang lebih Rp. 100.000,- dari 1 ekor babi. Dari keuntungan itu Tiyarmini membeli 3 ekor bibit babi penggemukan. Pada periode kedua ini, Tiyarmini mengajukan pinjaman lagi untuk modal pakan dan membeli 2 ekor bibit penggemukan. Sehingga Dia bisa memelihara lebih banyak babi dan dapatkan keuntungan yang lebih banyak lagi.
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Tiyarmini used the funding from her 1st Dinari loan to build a pig hut and to buy pig feed. She initially had 2 piglets and she earned a total of USD 17.6 from them. She used that money to buy another 3 piglets.

Ni Ketut Tiyarmini is planning to participate in her 2nd Dinari loan. She wants to use the loan money to buy pig feed and to buy another 2 piglets. She is hoping to earn more money by raising more piglets.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy feeds and piglets

loans.name: Ni Putu Murdani

texts.id: Putu Murdani baru saja menyelesaikan pinjaman periode pertamanya di Dinari. Uang dari Dinari tersebut digunakan untuk memperbaiki lantai kandang babinya yang sudah rusak. Sisanya digunakan untuk membeli pakan babinya. Saat itu Murdani memelihara 4 ekor babi penggemukan. Dari 4 ekor babi tersebut Murdani mendapatkan keuntungan kurang lebih Rp. 500.000,- Sekarang Murdani baru memelihara 1 ekor babi saja. Rencananya Dia akan memelihara 2 ekor lagi. Untuk itu Murdani mengajukan pinjaman lagi ke Dinari. Supaya Dia bisa membeli bibit babi lagi. Sisanya akan digunakan untuk membeli pakan babinya.
texts.en:
Putu Murdani just completed her 1st Dinari loan. She used that loan money to improve the flooring of her pig hut and also on the pig feed. At that time she was raising 4 piglets. From them she earned a total of USD 44.

At this moment she has only 1 piglet. She is planning to buy another 2 piglets. Therefore she wants to participate in her 2nd Dinari loan. She will use the money to buy more piglets and pig feed.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy feeds and piglets

loans.name: Ni Putu Sulasmi

texts.id: Walaupun kandangnya sangat sederhana yang terbuat dari bambu, Putu Sulasmi tidak mengurungkan niatnya untuk memelihara babi. Eman bulan yang lalu, Sulasmi baru bergabung bersama program ternak babi yang ada di Dinari. Pada periode pertama, Sulasmi memelihara 5 ekor babi penggemukan. Setelah berjalan 6 bulan, tiba waktunya Sulasmi memanen atau menjual babi peliharaanya tersebut. Setelah dijual, ternyata Sulasmi mendapat keuntungan kurang lebih Rp. 650.000,- dari 5 ekor babinya tersebut. Sekarang Sulasmi baru memelihara 3 ekor babi penggemukan. Sulasmi ingin menambah 2 ekor babi lagi. Di periode kedua ini, Sulasmi mengajukan pinjaman lagi supaya Dia bisa menambah babi peliharaannya. Kemudian sisa uangnya digunakan untuk membeli pakan babinya.
texts.en:
Six months ago Putu Sulasmi participated in Dinari pig farming program. She started with 5 piglets and after six months period she earned a profit of USD 57.

At this moment she still has 3 piglets. She wants to have another 2. In this 2nd loan period she will use the money to buy more piglets and pig feed.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy feeds and piglets

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia H. is a 62-year-old mother of five. Her husband, Cornelio, is a laborer. They live in the beautiful town of Sibalom, Antique, on the island of Panay. Their town is the rice bowl for the province and also a center of trading. However, Alicia chooces to practice her expertise learned from her mother since childhood instead of engaging in other business. 

Alicia is very proud that out of her income from sewing, she was able to send her three daughters and one son to college to earn a degree. She has applied for this loan to buy assorted fabrics and other materials she needs to fill her customers' orders. She will buy the materials in bulk in order to get a lower price in the market. She hopes that in the future she can establish a shop separate from her house, and she plans to buy another sewing machine to improve her finished products in order to hold on to her regular customers.

loans.use: To buy assorted fabrics for sewing

loans.name: Noun

texts.en:
Almost one hectare of the farmland in Banteay Meanchey Province is used by Mrs. Noun Y. for cultivating rice and some vegetable crops for the village. Noun Y., 56, has been farming for years, a skill she is widely known for since she was left her grandparents' side. Her husband's name is Yoeun, 66, and he helps with her with the farm work. The family has four children; two of them are single and the others are married and live away from the family home. Three of their children are employed.

Because rice farming is the family's main source of income and the rice dry season is approaching, Noun Y. needs to borrow US$ 1200 as capital to use in her business activities, buying fertilizer, a second-hand motorcycle, and to pay for plowing her fields.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, a second-hand motorcycle, and to pay for plowing her field

loans.name: Syfudin

texts.en:
The man who is pictured is Syfudin the son of A.. He lives in District 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has six children. He is busy selling birds and is happy keeping different kinds of them. He loves his business, and he is very interested in increasing his business. Thus, he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months to buy more birds to sell. 
He would like to say that Kiva is an effective organization that supports entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To buy birds

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita G. is a mother with determination. She has worked very hard to support her two children ever since her husband abandoned them. She and her children were barely able to survive on her little income from washing clothes for her neighbor. She joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) to get capital to start a business and gain more income. Her membership in ASHI has impacted her life, especially her confidence. She was able to earn respect from others. She applied for this loan to buy a pig for fattening and to buy rice to sell. In the future, she wants to expand her pigpen so she can raise more pigs and she wants to continue selling rice in order to keep her regular customers. She hopes that she and her children can escape from the bondage of poverty.

loans.use: To buy a pig and rice

loans.name: No

texts.en: No S., 61, has been selling fresh fish for more than four years. He usually sells fish that he buys from fisherman. He uses his old motorcycle to transport the fish. He can generate an income of approximately $5 per day to feed his family. He is married to Mrs. Yan, 56, who helps support the family by growing rice. This couple has four children; three are married, and two are employed; one is a construction worker and the other is a mobile phone repairer in Phnom Penh. Recently, Mr. S.'s income has been decreasing, because his old motorcycle has broken frequently. Therefore, he is asking for a loan to add to his saving to buy a new motorcycle, so he can use it to make transportation easier. The family lives in the rural area of Banteay Meanchey Province.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Mohammad Nahim

texts.en:
M. Nahim is the son of M. A.. He lives in district 12th, Kabul Afghanistan. He is married and lives in a family of five members. He is a wood seller and all the family members benefit from the income he generates. M. Nahim has six years experience in this business and he is confident that he can work harder.
He would like to expand his business and buy more wood, so he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months. He hopes to increase his business as soon as possible and bring some new changes to it. He wants to say that Kiva is a really effective process.

loans.use: To purchase more wood and expand his business

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.en: A. Khursheda first applied to MicroInvest in 2005 and thanks to the previous loans, she could normalize the existing business in terms of market competition. Khursheda is engaged in commercial service and trade. She has a trade outlet in the local crowded bazaar where she trades towels that she brings from China and Iran. Khursheda has been in the towel trading business for five years. Khursheda has her last loan repayment in April and she is applying to KIVA for a business support loan of 4100 STJ for two months to import new wares.

loans.use: To import new wares

loans.name: Tuty

texts.en: P. Tuty lives in Khujand. She is married with five children. Tuty first applied to MicroInvest in 2005 and she intends to continue working tightly with our program so she is successful in the MicroInvest loan procedure. The increase in business turnover shows her business development and Tuty takes the next loan step. Tuty is engaged in selling children's wear. She has a good assortment that she brings from Istaravshan and Uzbekistan. Tuty has been trading in children's wear for nine years so she has repeat customers. Tuty applied to KIVA for a business support loan of 800 STJ for three months to import the new seasonal wear that permits her to increase her business turnover. Tuty thanks KIVA for its support and wishes all the best.

loans.use: To import seasonal wear

loans.name: Korn

texts.en: Korn S. (not shown), 43, is married with three children and lives with her husband in the Kampong Chhnang province.  She is a good housewife and cooks food for her family.  Her husband, pictured here, is a mechanic who makes $13 profit every day.  Two of their children are students and one is a photographer.  Korn would like to take out a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for her son for commuting to work.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike for son.

loans.name: Nhep

texts.en: Nhep P., age 51, is a villager living in Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. He cultivates rice on his own farmland inherited from his grandmother; he can plant twice a year with two seasons, including dry season and rainy season. He also raises cows for their offspring and to help his farm work. His wife, Mrs. Chamrit, 43, earns a living by selling fish in the local market and raises pigs at home. The family lives with their five children,  all single. To help support the family's food needs, three of their children (two sons and one daughter) are employed. Nhep P. has requested a $500 loan as capital to purchase fertilizer and to pay for plowing their field. (Nhep P.'s wife is pictured, because he was not available that day.)

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Eung

texts.en: Eung P. (not shown) is 39 years old and she resides with her husband in Kompong Chhnang province.  To earn a living, she has sold fish since 1997 and is able to make $5 profit every day.  Her husband, pictured here, is a farmer and sometime he sells wood.  On average, he makes $5 a day.  This couple has five children, four of whom are students and one works.  Eung P. would like a loan of $1000 to purchase land for her husband to expand cultivation.

loans.use: Purchase land to expand cultivation.

loans.name: Bulendga Twekembe (B) Group

texts.en: Annet is a used clothes saleswoman.  She specializes in women’s skirts.  Each week she travels to Kampala and, one by one, she chooses skirts to sell in her shop.  She can buy a skirt at about 2,000 USH and she can resell it at about 3,500 USH.  Usually she sells her skirts at the local market where she pays 500 USH rent per day.  Annet has been in this business for about 10 years now.  She works alone at her location, but her husband has a different stall at the market.  The work that she and her husband do, supports their four children. Since their children range from ages 17 to 5, they are all currently in school.  This means there is a heavy burden for the parents to carry. Annet says that although she could still be in the skirt-selling business without loans, the loans allow her to reduce her expenses. When she uses loans she is able to buy more skirts when she goes to Kampala.  This gives her more selection and reduces transport costs. In this loan cycle, Annet is requesting a loan of 300,000 to purchase a large stock of skirts.

loans.use: To buy skirts to sell.

loans.name: Kouch

texts.en:
Kouch N., 48, is married with four children and lives with her husband in Kampong Chhnang province. Her husband is the head of the family. Her is a fisherman and makes $5 profit every day. One of their children is a garment factory worker.

Kouch is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi. This will help him earn additional income to support the family.

loans.use: Purchase moto-taxi for husband.

loans.name: Ghulam Habib

texts.en:
Ghulam Habib is the son of Abdullah. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and lives in a ten-member family. He is a farmer and a very hard working Afghan man. He has worked as a farmer in the land since he was a child. For better improvement of his business and to purchase the required tools, he wants to take an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months.
He is happy that there is an effective process for the support of Afghan entrepreneurs in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy required tools

loans.name: Yeu

texts.en: Yeu S. (not shown), 42, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Chhnang province.  She has three school-aged children.  Yeu makes about $7 daily in revenue by raising fish from her home.  Her husband, pictured here, is a fisherman who earns $11 in revenue per day.  Yeu is asking for a loan to purchase fish food and fishing tools.

loans.use: Purchase feed for fish and fishing tools.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda D. is a 46-year-old mother of five. Her husband is a farmer who works a small parcel of land inherited from his parents. Their small income from farming is not enough to sustain the needs of the family, especially the education of her children. She joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) to get capital to buy a pig for fattening and to buy assorted foods for the variety store she wants to open. She wants to engage in this type of business in order to increase her income so that she can save for the education of her children; one in secondary school, two in elementary school, and one in preparatory school. She hopes to motivate her eldest son Julito to pursue his studies; he stopped schooling for many years because of poverty. She wants her children to graduate from college and land a good job; not experience anymore her experience of being out of friends because of their status. She hopes that with her new venture, she can save more money to build a better house.

loans.use: To buy pigs for fattening and assorted foods for a variety store.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly S. (not shown) is 53 years old and has a business selling coffee and grocery items from her home.  Every day, she is able to make $10 in revenue.  Her husband, pictured here, is a cow dealer and makes $5 in revenue per day. This couple has one child.  Ly S. is asking for a loan to purchase a cow for her husband to sell.

loans.use: Purchase a cow to sell.

loans.name: Roza

texts.en: Roza was born in 1950. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town; she is now settled in the Fuzuli region in Kayidish village, which was built for IDPs. Eight years ago, she started a dairy business. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy three cows. She is a mother of five children.

loans.use: To buy three cows

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea T. is 42 years old and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Ly Pov, 42, are farmers who typically make a combined US$2.00 every day. This couple has two children, one of whom is a driver and the other is a worker.

To make more money to help support the family, Chea T. needs a loan from Kiva to make a new investment. She will use all the money to purchase a generator so she can have a business recharging batteries. People in the village are dependent on batteries to power their lighting.

(Mrs. Chea T. and her husband are pictured at home.)

loans.use: To buy a generator.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion S. is a 28-year-old mother of two. Her husband, J.C. Rey, is a laborer. When she got married, she started selling fruits and vegetables. Their income is not enough to support the needs of her growing kids. She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirtap, Inc.) to get capital to start a new business. She applied for this loan to buy one piglet for fattening and to buy assorted ingredients such as milk, gelatin, peanuts, bananas, refined sugar, ice cubes and others to make "halo-halo" (or mixed fruits with shredded ice cubes), which is in demand in their place during summer. 
She dreams of expanding her pigpen in the future, to raise more pigs. She wants also to save money out of her food vending to sustain their daily needs. She hopes that through her loans availed of ASHI in partnership with Kiva, someday she will be able to discover her talent to engage in a more productive business.

loans.use: To buy pig for fattening and to buy assorted ingredients for food vending.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam S. is 35 years old and resides with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She has one young school-aged child and has a business selling grocery items in front of a garment factory. On average, she is able to make about US$4 per day. Her husband is a moto-taxi driver and earns US$3 of profit every day. Mrs. Sam S. is asking for a loan in order to expand her grocery store by adding more items to meet the demands of her customers. (Mrs. Sam S. is pictured with her husband).

loans.use: To buy items to expand grocery store.

loans.name: Rafig

texts.en: Rafig is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region in Horadiz settlement. This man was born in 1965. He has been in a dairy business for 7 years. Now, he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 3 cows for improving his dairy business. Rafig is married and has 5 children.

loans.use: To buy 3 cows

loans.name: Abdumurat

texts.ru: Абдумурат мужчина 36 лет , женат имеет троих детей.Работает в колхозе трактористом.Жена занимается продажей домашнего коровьего молока.Сам Абдумурат дополнительно занимается откормом и продажей скота.Сейчас у него две коровы и десять баранов.Его друзья посоветовали в кредит купить ещё пару коров.Для чего и обратился Абдумурат в Микроинвест.Семейное положение у него среднего проживания.Проживает он в Сомгаре, где очень много озеленённых пастбищ для прогулки скотов.На пастбища выводит скот сын Абдумурата.
texts.en:
Zulmurat is a 36 year old man, he is married and has three children. He works at a collective farm as a tractor driver. His wife sells cows’ milk. Zulmurat also raises and sells livestock. Right now he owns two cows and ten sheep. His friends advised him to purchase a couple more cows on credit. This is why Zulmurat turned to MicroInvest. His family is middle class. He lives in Somgar where there are a lot of green pastures for livestock. Zulmurat’s son takes the livestock out to pasture.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam S., 36, is married with five children. She and her family live in the Kampong Cham Province. She works as a farmer, typically earning $2 USD per day. Her husband, Chen Kosal, 37, is a construction worker who builds houses. He normally earns $3 USD per day. Mrs. Sam S. would like a loan to purchase construction tools for her husband.

loans.use: Purchase construction tools

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn P., a 27-year-old mother five, is married to Rey, who farms a small parcel of land. Analyn and Rey work very hard to raise their family, hoping in the near future  to escape the oppression of their current poverty.  Analyn joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) to secure capital to begin a new venture as she plans to buy 100 ducks in order to fully utilize their land. She also intends to purchase assorted foods to start a variety store that will provide for some of her neighbors’ basic needs, saving them long trips to larger stores just to buy a single piece of garlic or a few onions, for example.  

Analyn hopes that in the future her number of ducks will increase and her small variety store will grow to better serve her customers. She dreams of saving enough money to be able to send her children to university.

loans.use: To buy 100 ducks to raise and assorted foods for her variety store.

loans.name: Sot

texts.en: Sot P. is 42 years old and resides with her husband in the Kampong Cham Province. To earn a living, she has raised fish from her home and is able to make $2 USD of profit every day, while her husband earns about $5 a day by selling the eggs from the ducks that he raises at the market. This couple has five children, two of whom are students and two who are garment factory workers. Mrs. Sot P. would like to take out a loan to purchase fish food and livestock. Here, Sot P. is pictured with her husband at home.

loans.use: To purchase fish food and raise more ducks

loans.name: Lov

texts.en:
Mrs. Lov N., 33, married to Mr. Sim, a taxi driver, has one teenage child enrolled in the local public school. Lov sells traditional Khmer cakes, purchasing her ingredients from the market, making the cakes in her home and selling them to her neighbors. 

Currently reliant upon taxis, Lov is hoping to reduce her transportation costs by requesting a loan to buy a second-hand motorbike and increase her business capital.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorbike.

loans.name: Phoung

texts.en: Phoung S., 38, is married and resides with her husband in the Kompong Cham province. She sells grocery items and is able to make US$3 of profit every day. Her husband is a policeman and earns US$2 per day. This couple has two young school-aged children. Mrs. Phoun S. needs to loan from CREDIT to expand her grocery's inventory in order to scarify her customer's needs.

loans.use: To expand a grocery store.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein, 22, lives with his parents in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon where he has owned a DVD, CD and cassette shop for a year. Hussein is requesting a loan of $1000 from Al Majomoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is his first loan request.
 
Hussein is special in his work because he is the only one offering this merchandise in the region. When he first started the business, he had financial issues, but his experience and desire for independent work have enabled him to succeed.  In the future, Hussein plans to expand the business.

loans.use: Hussein will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna B. is a 40 year-old mother of seven. Her husband is a farmer. Her eldest daughter Ma. Rosemarie stopped schooling after graduating from her secondary education. Her second daughter Kristine, and third son Eduardo, are already in secondary school. Mea Vita and Sharmie Zandra are in elementary grades while Verna Cattlia and Edmer still need to be fed. The couple's income is not enough to sustain the basic needs of the family.

Myrna heard about ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), who provide loans to the poor, from her friend. She was motivated to join and she got capital to start a business. She applied for a loan to buy assorted foods for her variety store. She hopes that, with her new venture, she can save enough money to support the needs of her seven children. She dreams of expanding her store in the future through the able support of her husband.

She is very grateful to the lenders who will support them in achieving their dreams.

loans.use: To buy assorted foods for her variety store

loans.name: Bayoglan

texts.en:
Bayoglan was born in 1963. He is married and has four children. This man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region in Kurdmahmudlu village.

Seven years ago Bayoglan started a taxi business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy spare parts for improving his taxi business.

loans.use: To buy the spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said B. runs a grocery store at Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam. He sells a variety of soft drinks, Coke, and Pepsi products including fruit juices. He is married with three schoolchildren.

Soft drinks are in high demand in a hot region like Dar es Salaam. Income generated from the business is used to meet his families daily needs. He needs a loan of Tshs 600,000 to boost the business by buying more stock.

loans.use: To buy more stock for his business

loans.name: Ismatullo

texts.ru: Бобоев Исматулло житель Варзобского района. Возраст 53 года , женат и имеет шестерых детей. Всю свою семью обеспечивает один . Работает строителем по найму. Кроме того занимается разведением коз. Опыт в данном бизнесе составляет два года. Так как козы , при хорошем уходе могут давать потомство даже два раза в год , то этот бизнес является прибыльным. Поэтому он решил обратиться к нам за кредитом , при помощи которого он сможет закупить несколько голов породистых коз.
texts.en:
Ismatullo B. lives in the Varzob district. He is 53 years old, married and has six children. He is the sole provider for his family. He works as construction worker for hire. Besides this work, he is also involved in breeding goats. Ismatullo has 2 years of experience in this business. When well-taken care of, goats can breed twice per year, making this a profitable business. This is why Ismatullo decided to obtain a loan to help him purchase several purebred goats.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Duch

texts.en:
A medium-size farmland located in Pursat Province is used by Mrs. Duch S. for growing rice and vegetables. As another source of income, she also raises pigs in a stall next to her house and sells her mature pigs to a slaughterer three times a year. Her husband works as a local palm climber. With the palm climbing, S.'s husband can tap more than 20 liters of palm juice a day and turns it into palm wine or boils it into palm sugar for sale.

S. has applied for a $500 loan to be used to purchase additional piglets and feed for raising. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living. S.'s husband is pictured.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Maua

texts.en: Maua J. is a married woman who runs a pub at Ubungo Bus Terminal in Dar es Salaam in Tanzania. She sells different types of soft and alcoholic drinks to her customers. She purchases stock from the wholesale suppliers and from the retail-business man. She has been in the business for four years and she feeds her family from her business income. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to keep up the business.

loans.use: To buy stock for her pub

loans.name: Ibodullo

texts.ru: Бобоев Ибодулло житель Варзоба. Варзоб это скалистая местность , где   основная часть населения занимается животноводчеством. Многие жители работают в городе Душанбе. И очень маленькая часть населения занимается сельским хозяйством. Ибодулло строитель, женат и имеет двоих детей., но уже 10 лет имеет хозяйство с козами. Сейчас решил получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. На деньги полученные у нас он купит несколько породистых коз.
texts.en:
Ibodullo B. lives in Varzob. Varzob is a mountainous area where the main portion of the population raises livestock. Many residents work in Dushanbe. A very small portion works in agriculture. Ibodullo is a builder, he is married and has two children, but for 10 years now he has a plot with goats. Now he decided to take out a loan in order to increase his livestock headcount. He will use the money that he gets from us to purchase several bred goats.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goats

loans.name: Zaila

texts.en: Zaila K. is a small businesswoman. She runs a café at Tandika ward in Dar es Salaam. She employs two workers who assist her in serving the customers. She purchases the business requirements from Kariakoo city market and the surrounding food shops. Income generated from the business is used to meet her customers' demand. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to expand the business by purchasing more business items.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann R. is a 30-year-old mother of five. Her husband Jerry makes buko (coconut) juice which he sells in the nearby school. Mary Ann does laundry for her neighbors just to help her husband. When she heard about ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) entering their village to provide loans to mothers with dreams of putting up a business, she did not think twice before joining the organization to get capital. 

Mary Ann wants to venture into selling rice, dried fish, kerosene, and chicken. She applied for this loan to purchase the mentioned items to increase their income. She hopes to establish a successful grocery store in future and to stop doing laundry in order to take care of her children and business at home. She is positive that with her initial capital accessed through ASHI and KIVA, her dreams of sending her children to a university will be achieved.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of rice, five kilos dried fish, 2 liters kerosene, and 2 pieces of chicken

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia has maintained a small furniture business for almost 30 years now. Aside from making furniture, she is also engaged in fish vending for extra income to meet the needs of her family. She is now requesting a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 to be utilized for the growth of their furniture business. Through her business, she believes that she can provide a better life for her children. She and her husband love their children so much and they want them to be successful someday.

Celia is 52 years old and married to Leonardo with whom she has four children: the eldest is Ma. Christina, 25 years old; Ricky, 24 years old; Charibel, 18 years, a college student, and the youngest is Lester, 14 years old; he is a special child and he cannot go to school.

loans.use: Business Assistance

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is married to Emilio, her business partner. They do not have any children and are still wishing to have one someday. The couple is engaged in furniture making and so far they can say that their business is doing well by helping one another.

Margarita wants to improve their business. This is the reason why she is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 14,000 that they can use as additional capital. They are planning to utilize the loan in purchasing wood and other materials needed in furniture making. Margarita has a principle in life which is, “you have to stick to one business and die for it if you really want to succeed”; that really shows her strong determination to work hard, for she wants to save for their future.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 53 years old and a store-owner. She and her husband have four children: Daisy, the eldest is 32 years old, presently working in their municipal hall; Denies, 31 years old, is a graduate in agriculture but employed as a factory worker in Laguna; Glenda, 29 years old, college undergraduate due to her early marriage; and Mery Jain, 26 years old, a college undergraduate due to financial difficulties.

Margarita has been operating her retail business for almost a year. She is now requesting the loan amount of PHP 5,000. She will use the loan to purchase additional groceries for her store since her income of PHP 150 is not enough to meet all their needs. If given the chance, she is also planning to engage in hog raising and a poultry business for extra income.

Though their children are living in different places with their own families, they still have a good communication. She hopes that someday she can become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase additonal inventory

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna has been involved in a food vending business for years. She wants to expand her business for the benefit of her customers. For the fulfillment of her plan, she would like to borrow at least PHP 5,000 that she can use as business capital. She enjoys her business because of her fondness for cooking. From her simple business, she was able to help her husband in supporting the educational needs of their children.

Myrna is married to Benigno, a furniture maker in their village. They have four children: Cristina - 19 years old and Barbie - 18 years old are already college students; Beejay -14 years old, a high school student and John Lloyd, in the elementary level. They live in a village where furniture-making is the major source of income of the residents. She is grateful that her husband is also helping her in her business. She hopes that someday all her children will finish their studies and find good jobs.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is married to Adriano, a wood carver. The couple was blessed with five children: Adrian-25, an electrical engineer; Ariane - 23, college student; Francis Benedict - 19, works as a laborer; Ma. Luisa – 18 years old, an undergraduate; and Raymart – 15 years old, is a high school student.

Editha is a vegetable vendor in their village. She is planning to purchase more vegetables for the growth of her business. And for the realization of her plans, she is requesting to access a loan of PHP 8,000 that she can use as added business capital. Said amount will be of great help not only for her business but also for their family. With an increase in income, she can support the needs of their family, especially her children.

Editha has been a vegetable vendor for many years and she is doing her best to become successful in reaching her goals. She believes that being patient and through hard work is the best way to success.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is engaged in the sari-sari (variety) store business (a community-based store) in their village. Aside from selling basic commodities, she also sells vegetables and fish. She has been in this business for five years and her business has been her partner in supporting the needs of her children and their farming needs.

To pursue the growth of her business, Natividad would like to request the loan amount of PHP 4,000 which is just enough to maintain her business. She is hoping that her request will be granted for the benefit of her family. Natividad M. is 50 years old and married to Danilo, who works as a farmer. They are blessed with seven children: Virgie - 31 years old; Jodie - 28 years old, and Jonathan - 26 years old; these three did not finish their college education due to early marriage. Lordin - 23 years old is a high school graduate and now employed as a construction worker; Leo - 21 years old and Donald - 18 years old are both high school graduates and now helping their father in their farm. The youngest is Diana Via, 10 years old and already an elementary student.

loans.use: Business Maintenance

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan manages a tricycle transport business. He is 25 years old and married to Wilma. They have a one-year-old child named Jhonwelle and they live in Sta. Cruz, Benito Soliven, Isabela. His wife just stays at home and takes care of their son and does the household chores while he works as a tricycle (local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver.

Jonathan is hoping to have business capital for them to have an alternative source of income that will be manages by his wife. As a driver for four years, his income is insufficient to meet all their needs especially now that everything is more expensive. This made him decide to request a loan of PHP 4,000 that they will use to start up a vending business.

Since it is summer, he and his wife will sell “halo-halo” (halo means mix –it is a popular Filipino dessert that is a mixture of shaved ice and milk to which are added various boiled sweet beans and fruits, served cold in tall glass or bowl.) His wife will manage their vending business since she only needs to stay at home and display her products in front of their house. The loan is really of big help if provided because it is the only way they know to cope up with the prevailing crisis that they are experiencing.

Jonathan dreams of having a happy and healthy family. He also hopes that he can send his son to school all the way through college. This is the reason why he is doing his best to achieve his goal.

loans.use: To start a new business selling food

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is engaged in a vending business. Some of the things she sells are vegetables and rice. She is glad that she can earn at least PHP 1,000 a week and she budgets her income as a rolling capital in the business and to cover the school allowance of her son.

At present, she is asking for financial assistance in the amount of PHP 5,000 that she will use to purchase more stock. She is hoping that her loan will be granted so that her income will increase and meet the needs of her family. She always bears in mind that to be successful in life, one should exert more effort to succeed.

Ms. Cristina is 25 years old and her husband is working as a carpenter. They have a seven-year-old son and he is now in the elementary level. Her son serves as their inspiration to work hard for their future.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene T. has been engaged in direct selling for two years. She is now in need of additional capital to increase her range of products and is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000. Her desire to give her children a better education and a progressive way of living gives her the strength to sustain her business. Irene always believes that time is very important so she needs to make the best use of it.

Irene is a 41-year-old and her husband Rolando is working as an Overseas Filipino Worker or OFW. They have three children who are all studying in the secondary level of education in their town: Kelvin, 17 years old; Karen, 15 years old and Fristel, 13 years old. They live in a village which is known for furniture products. Irene is hoping that through her direct selling, she will able to help her husband who is sacrificing abroad to satisfy their basic needs and the educational needs of their children.

loans.use: To increase her range of products

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 40 years old and lives in the village of Alinguigan 3rd, Ilagan, Isabela with her family. Her husband Dominador is working as a tricycle (local three-wheeled motor vehicle) operator. The couple has three children: Jemilyn - 22 years old, third year college; Jessa - 18 years old, second year college; and Jefferson – 14 years old, second year high school. Jesusa is very happy that they have a good and harmonious relationship within her family.

Jesusa wants to help her husband in providing for the needs of their family. Since his tricycle has been their main source of income, she would like to request a loan of PHP 4,000 for the maintenance of their tricycle. She is also planning to use some of the loan money to start a vending business but they will prioritize their tricycle.

loans.use: Tricycle Maintenance

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is engaged in the furniture-making business. She is 42 years old and married to Charlie, who helps her in managing their small business. They were blessed with two children: Allan - 23 years old, still a high school student and Karen - 16 years old, also a high school student. They live simply in Allinguigan 3rd, Ilagan, Isabela.

Terisita and her husband started their business 15 years ago and they are now generating a monthly income of PHP 2,000. She can say that her success in this kind of business is through patience and her positive attitude. To further improve her business, she would like to request the loan amount of PHP 7,000 that she will use to buy wood and other materials they needed in making furniture. Said amount will be of great help in pursuing her business and generating more income. She is hoping that someday her children will finish their studies thanks to their small enterprise.

Teresita is happy that her family has a harmonious relationship. In this way, she is always inspired to work hard.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Menecia

texts.en:
Menecia is already two years managing her community-based store. Aside from selling basic commodities, she also put up a small eatery beside their house. Since her businesses requires additional capital, she is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 from the lenders. She will use the amount to purchase additional merchandise for her store and for her eatery business. She wants to save money for the education of her children in college and plans to sustain her business for a long time since it has been their source of income.

Menecia is 40 years old and married to Danilo, who happens to be the captain in their village. The couple is blessed with three children: Rexon, 19 years old, and Dave, 18 years old, both high school graduates and Jose, the youngest, who is still studying as a high school student. Menecia plans to continue to send her two sons to school and to pursue their college education. She wants herself and her children to be successful in life.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her store and for her eatery business

loans.name: Marinel

texts.en:
Marinel is 32 years old and is residing in Allinguigan 3rd together with her husband George, who is a wood carver. They are blessed with three children: Lelina Mae - 9 years old; John Oliver - 7 years old (both  already in elementary level); and the youngest, Gia Marie - 4 years old. 

Marinel is a rice retailer in their village. To meet the growing needs of her family especially in sending their children to school, she is now requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 as additional capital for her rice retailing business. In this way, she can also help her husband in providing for their basic needs and also for the school allowance of their children.

loans.use: Additional capital for her rice retailing business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is engaged in a furniture-making business. She and her family live in Allinguigan 3rd, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 38 years old and is married to Felipe, who serves as a village captain. They have four children who are all studying: Ricky Mark - 16 years old, a graduating high school student; Ceener - 15 years old, 3rd-year high school; Peejay, 12 years old, also in high school; and the youngest, Loraine - 10 years old, an elementary student.

Jocelyn and her husband are business partners in managing their small business. To pursue her plan of purchasing wood and other materials they need in furniture making, she would like to borrow a loan amount of PHP 8,000. This amount will serve as her business capital and hopefully she can also use it for business expansion. She hopes that she can have more products to display in their shop but they could not do so before because of limited resources.

As a mother, Jocelyn wants to send all her children to college and see them finish their studies. She hopes that through their business, they can fulfill their dreams for their children.

loans.use: To purchase materials for furniture making

loans.name: Tagoimurod

texts.ru: Холов Тагоймурод проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст 57 лет, женат и имеет пятерых детей. Работает водителем . Имеет  грузовую автомашину , которую использует  в качестве перевоза  грузов , а так же крупно и мелко рогатого скота. Кроме этого занимается животноводством. Имеет хозяйство , где разводит коз. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Это даст возможность развивать бизнес , а  так же займет делом членов его семьи.
texts.en:
Tagoimurod H. lives in the Varzob area. He is 57 years old, is married and has five children. He works as a driver. He owns a truck which he uses to transport freight and small and large livestock. In addition he raises livestock. He has a plot where he raises goats. Tagoimurod plans to take out a loan in order to increase his livestock headcount. This will allow him to grow his business and will also give work to members of his family.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goats

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita owns and manages a sari-sari store (community based variety store) in their village in Alinguigan 3rd. Her weekly income of PHP 1,500 was being budget for the needs of her family and as a rolling capital for her business. However, this was not enough to support all their needs. For this, Merlita wanted to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise that she can sell for a bigger income. Thus, she is hoping to obtain a loan of PHP 10,000. She is hoping that her request is granted so that she is able to pursue her business plan.

Merlita is married to Espedito and he is working as a jeepney (small bus) driver. They are blessed with five children who are all studying: Marjorene -19 years old, a B.S. Information Technology student; Joana Marie - 16 years old and Dianne - 15 years old, both high school students; Mark Anthony - 12 years old and Christine, 9 years are in the elementary level. Merlita is happy that they have unity in their family.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ivet

texts.en:
Iveth resides in the rural area of Allinguigan 3rd, a place known for making wood furniture. She is 22 years old and married to Jeffrey, a furniture shipper. They are blessed with two children: Macarias, 6 years old, and Mark John, 2 years old. Iveth is happy because she and her husband are helping each other in meeting their goals for their family.

Iveth engaged herself in direct-selling businesses such as MSE and NATASHA, selling their products to earn income for her family. Her income of PHP 1,300 a month is not enough to support all her children’s need. Therefore, she decided to borrow PHP 4,000 which could help her business to grow.

Iveth is a very hardworking woman and dreams that someday her business will grow and expand into some other kind of enterprise. She is hoping that her request will be granted for it will help her family and her business a lot.

loans.use: To help her business to grow

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose C. is 60 years old and married to Nenita. They live in the village of Alinguigan, 3rd Ilagan, Isabela together with their two children: Jasper - 18 years old, 2nd year college; and Naneth - 11 years old, an elementary student.

Jose is helping his wife in their retailing business. Despite his age, he is still striving to be productive. His dream is to see his children finish their studies in the future. He is now hoping to access a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 that they will use to purchase more goods that they can sell. He is doing this for the benefit of his children and he hopes that his request will be granted by the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for re-sale

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda A. is a 45-year-old mother of five. Her husband Eddie used to make charcoal. They live in a mountainous part of the village of Ilaures, Bugasong, Antique, on the island of Panay. After typhoon Frank, the strongest typhoon of 2008 that hit the province, damaging thousand of hectares of forests and rice fields, the couple felt guilty at what they are doing to the trees, just to feed their family when they sold the charcoal they were producing. 

When they heard of ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), entering their village providing loans to the poor, the couple got interested and applied for a loan to start a better business. Luzviminda applied for a loan to buy one pig for fattening, 10 chickens to raise and buy one sack of rice to sell. 

The couple is hoping to put up a business more friendly to the environment and is very optimistic to overcome the poverty by sending their five children to school to have a degree, and be a better citizen in the future.

loans.use: To buy a pig for fattening, 10 chickens, and one sack of rice for retail

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara is residing in the upper part of Allinguigan 3rd of Ilagan, Isabela with her family and immediate relatives. She is already 52 years old and living a happy and contented single life. Her main source of income is vending: she sells fish and vegetables in their village.

At present, Barbara wants to expand her business and she also aims to have a stall in the market to have more customers and have an increase in income. With this, she is now borrowing of PHP 7,000 that she can use as additional business capital that would be of great help in pursuing her business plan.

According to Barbara, being single is not a hindrance to achieving her goals in life. She believes that time is golden and every coin is indispensable especially now that everyone is experiencing an economic crisis.

loans.use: Additional Business Capital

loans.name: Djamal

texts.en: Djamal is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region in Mahmudlu-2 village. He was born in 1977. This man is married and has 4 children. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy foodstuffs for improving his business. He has 5 years of experience in this business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Phoem

texts.en:
Phoem P., age 54, has had a job as a domestic building worker for years. He now has three children who are teenagers; all three of them are students in the local public school. He is married to Mrs. Phearum, 47, who makes a living raising sows to sell their offspring.

Because the business of pig-raising is the family's main source of income and their investment has been growing, P. is applying for a loan to add to his wife's business capital so as to buy more pigs to raise. The family are people living in Pursat Province, Cambodia. (Mr. P.'s daughter is pictured, because he was not available.)

loans.use: To add to his wife's business capital

loans.name: Medcilyne

texts.en:
Medcilyne G. is a 36-year-old mother of seven. Her husband Manuel is a carpenter. They live in the beautiful town of Bugasong, Antique, on the island of Panay. The town is located in the central part of a sea-horse-shaped province on the Philippine map. The common livelihood is farming and fishing, however, due to scarcity of capital, Medcilyne's husband does not farm or fish; he chooses to do carpentry, for this job does not require capitalization. 

Before she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) she bought and re-sold whatever goods she could just to have an income, on irregular days of the week. She applied for this loan to get capital to buy one pig for fattening, to buy 10 chickens to raise, and buy assorted ingredients to start up food vending. She will utilize the loan properly so as to get another loan in the future to expand her business and to increase her income for the education of her children who are now going to finish their secondary school. She dreams of earning more confidence in venturing into a bigger business that ASHI and KIVA will support in fulfilling her dreams.

loans.use: To buy one piglet, 10 chickens, and ingedients for food vending

loans.name: Rokhaya's Group

texts.fr: Réunues au sein d'un groupe dénommé TAKKU LIGGEY DIALMA2 elles s'activent dans le commerce de detail depuis plusieurs années .Chacune d'elle vend de peitits objets .les revenus tiré de leurs activité leur permettent de subvenir à leurs besoins familliaux paiement de frais médicaux pour les enfants et pour elles .elles sollicitent ce pret pour renforcer leurs activités de commerce  .
texts.en:
For several years, these women have worked together selling small items within a group called TAKKU LIGGEY DIALMA2. The income generated from their business activities allows them to provide for family needs, including the payment of medical expenses for themselves and their children. They are requesting this loan to strengthen their retail business.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Mohammad Taher

texts.en:
The man in the photograph is Mohammad Taher, the son of A. A.. He lives in Bagrami, Kabul, Afghanistan. He is an old man of 65 and there are 9 members in his family.

He is eagerly interested in agriculture. Every morning, he wakes up at 6:00 a.m. and goes out to his land to start working. The income he receives monthly is not satisfactory for him. Therefore, he wants to take an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months to expand his business and to buy more seeds for his land. He hopes to have cultivated land and a high monthly income.

Finally, he wants to thank all the lenders.

loans.use: Buying more seeds

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg E. lives with her husband and two children in Arhanghay province, one of Mongolia’s central provinces. Both she and her husband are in the retail business at the local market. She sells household products such as small and large containers and plastic bags. Her husband sells ice cream at the local market.

Altantsetseg, with her husband, frequently travels to Narantuul market, the largest open-air market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. At Narantuul, she purchases household products and ice cream at wholesale prices and ships them to Arhanghay province.

Altantsetseg started her business in 2007 and since then the business has been doing well. Her working capital has increased from 100,000 MNT ($1 USD=1,400 MNT) to 400,000 MNT. Altantsetseg requests a loan to purchase more household products from Ulaanbaatar. At the picture: Altantsetseg and her husband Batbaatar.

loans.use: to purchase more household products for re-sale

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Battulga M. lives with his wife in Arhanghay province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. He has a small business selling clothes at the local market. His wife helps with his business.

In 1999, Battulga began importing clothes for women and men from a border city in Russia. However, the clothes were expensive and demand for expensive clothes was weak in Arhanghay. For this reason, he decided to switch the import market from the West to the East. Now he travels to Ereen, China, a border town where many goods are purchased for importation to Mongolia. There, he buys cheap women’s and men’s clothes for his retail shop.

In the meantime, his wife works at the stall as a saleswoman. He requests a loan to purchase more women’s and men’s clothes from China.

loans.use: to purchase more women’s and men’s clothes from China for re-sale

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca T. is a 42-year-old mother of six. Her husband Rudy is a fisherman. She sells fish caught by her husband to support the needs of the family. The family resides in the central town of the province where opportunities are rare for those who have no education. 

The couple was able to survive the challenges of life with their six children by their industry and courage to continue what they are doing. Rebecca was challenged when ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) entered in their village, bringing a doorstep of hope for mothers like her, with dreams of getting out of poverty if given the chance. She did not think twice about getting a loan to start up a new venture. She applied for this loan to buy one pig for fattening, buy and re-sell fish, and make foods for snacks.

Rebecca hopes that with the new businesses, she will be able to support the daily needs of her children. She hopes that in the future, she can establish a restaurant.

loans.use: To buy one pig for fattening, to buy and re-sell fish, and buy assorted ingredients for food vending

loans.name: Farooq

texts.en: Farooq is the son of G. Hider. He lives in Bagrami, Kabul, Afghnistan. He is 60 years old and a hard working farmer. There are 10 members in his family and he works with two of his sons to pay all of his family's living expenses. He would like to expand his business and purchase seeds and the needed tools for farming, so he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani. He is glad that through the loan process all entrepreneurs have the opportunity to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds.

loans.name: Chhiev

texts.en:
Chhiev H. is 35 years old and a resident of Pursat Province, Cambodia, where she makes a living selling vegetables that she grows on her farmland in the village. She can sell her produce to the buyers every 2 months, after she begins planting them. She is a widowed mother who has given birth to three children; all of them are school age and they also help with her business activities when they are not studying.

H. has been facing difficulty with transportation for a long time because she hasn't a motorbike to ride. Therefore, she would like to borrow US$ 500 in order to purchase a motorcycle so she can use it to transport her produce to the market for sale.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Battsagaan

texts.en: Battsagaan G. lives with his family in Arhangay province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Battsagaan has three teenage children who go to the local high school. In 2003, Battsagaan and his wife started their own business as wholesale meat vendors. They visit herders in the countryside with their truck and purchase livestock at a discount when they can. Once they bring the livestock home, they slaughter them and prepare them for sale. Once the meat is ready for the market, they sell it to wholesale middlemen from their town and Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In the future, they would like to create their own channel to bring livestock to the town without visiting each herder in the countryside. They request a loan to purchase livestock from herders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock from herders

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en: Battsetseg G. lives with her husband and three children in Arhangay province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Two of Battsetseg's children are university students, while her youngest daughter is a high school student. Although her husband runs a small carpentry shop, their income was not adequate to pay the family’s monthly expenses, which is especially burdensome with two children attending university. Hence, she decided to start a small private business to boost her family's income. She rents a small stall in the local shopping mall and sells wool and cashmere products. She frequently travels to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and purchases wool and cashmere products wholesale. In the future, she would like to diversify her business by opening a small cafeteria at the mall. She requests a loan to purchase more wool and cashmere products for her stall.

loans.use: To purchase more wool and cashmere products

loans.name: Arline

texts.en: Arline T. is a 35 year old mother of five. Her husband Vicente is a carpenter specialized in making furniture and started a furniture making business eleven years ago. He learned the trade of furniture making when he was working as a laborer in a shop. After their marriage, he was challenged to make their own furniture, and then he started accepting orders. However, they can not expand their business because of their lack of capital. Arline heard of ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) from her neighbor, and she tendered an application to buy the needed materials for her husband. She plans to use the loan to buy materials in bulk in order to get a lower price in the market. They are hoping that in the future their shop will expand and they will be able to build a separate building to display their finished products.

loans.use: To buy materials for furniture making.

loans.name: Khushbakht

texts.en:
Khushbakht B. is 34 years old. He is married and has 2 children of school age. Khushbakht produces national chests which are used to save for a bride's dowry. In Tajikistan, the chests are very colourful and made of wood. Khushbakht has been in the chest making business for 15 years. The stability of the business gives him a steady income and ensures that his family has the ability to improve their living conditions. Due to the high demand for his products, Khushbakht is requestion a loan of US$600 in order to purchase the raw materials needed to make more chests. Khushbakht is planning to pay the loan off in 11 months and thanks all the lenders who give him a chance to get ahead.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to produce chests.

loans.name: Noeuy's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan  for four women who are living in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Noeuy P., 30, has been selected to be group leader by the other members. Mrs P. currently grows different kinds of vegetables, which she will sell  to her buyers every 2 or 3 months after growing them. She is married with one teenage child who is a student. Her husband Chy,aged 30, is a local construction worker . The mature crop season is coming and Mrs P. is lacking the money to pay for harvesting her crops. In order to make that possible, she needs for a loan from HKL. The other three borrowers are:
You L. is a vegetable seller requesting a loan to repair her broken motorcycle for transportation.
You S. works as a building worker and she needs for a loan to buy piglets to raise.
You M. raises poultry from her home and she applies for a loan to pay poultry raising costs.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting her crops

loans.name: Maty's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TAKKU LIGGEY DIALMA5 regroupe des femmes qui oruvrent dans le cmmerce de produits divers alant de la vente de jus de fruit au savon et autre article de menage.elles ont crée leur association pour lutter contre la pauvrete et inactivité des femmes.depuis la création de leur association ,elles parviennent à satisfere individuellement leurs bsoins sans attendre leurs maris.
Pour renforcer leurs activité et accroitre leur fonds de roulement elles sollicitent un pret.
texts.en:
The TAKKU LIGGEY DIALMA 5 group is made up of women who work at selling various articles, from fruit juice to soap and other household items. They have set up their association to struggle against poverty and inactivity of women. Since the creation of their association, they each manage to satisfy their needs without counting on their husbands.

In order to bolster their businesses and increase their working capital, they are asking for a loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital for their little businesses

loans.name: Bibisoida

texts.en:
Bibisoida B. is a married mother of 6 children. For more than 10 years Bibisoida has been selling the national man’s coat called a “Chapan”. Considering that her husband works as a teacher and earns little, her coat  business  has been a valuable source of income for her and her family. In a typical month Bibisoida makes about $400 in profit from the business. Bibisoida has requested a loan of $ 800 USD to purchase new inventory. This loan will help her to continue developing her business and provide a good income for her family.

loans.use: Purchasing the national man’s coat called a “Chapan”.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle L. is a 24 year-old mother with one daughter. She resides in the capital town of the province. When Michelle got married to a jobless man she was challenged to look for a job in order to support her family. However, for a married women without degree, finding a job was difficult. There were times when Michelle felt that the world was so unfair. The poor become poorer and the rich become richer. But she continued her quest until she heard about ASHI (Ahon Sa HIrap, Inc.) that gives loans to mothers who wants to start a business. Michelle has applied for a loan to get capital to buy assorted foods for a variety store. She wants to save money for her child and hopes to serve her neighbors. Michelle dreams of  making her small store into a complete grocery store.

loans.use: To buy assorted foods for her variety store.

loans.name: Amriddin

texts.en:
B. Amriddin is dedicated to the production of dairy cattle. With a lot of effort and sacrifice he carries out this work every day for the purpose of improving the conditions of his family and bringing the daily bread to his table. At the same time, he is saving for the improvement of his dwelling, which needs a lot of help because it is in a bad state but which, little by little, he has come to improve. His family admires him for the fact that his multiple efforts have permitted him to bring food to his home and that in addition, Amriddin has managed to keep his three children in school.

The need that this gentleman faces is to invest in the development of his business through the purchase of cows. In this he hopes that IMON International, with the help of Kiva, will offer him the loan to help him to do well along with his family.

loans.use: To purchase cows for his business

loans.name: Davaadorj

texts.en:
Davaadorj S. is the widowed mother of two children. She lives in Arhanghay province, one of Mongolia's central provinces, with her son and grandson. Her son is a lawyer by training, but now works for his mother's business.

Since 2004, Davaadorj has been running a small souvenir shop in the local history museum. The items she sells are bought by her son wholesale in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. When she began to run her retail business, her working capital was 300,000 tugrug. As a result of her doing well, the capital has increased to 400,000 MNT.

Davaadorj requests a loan to purchase more "Made in Mongolia" souvenirs to increase her inventory as the tourism season approaches.

loans.use: To purchase more "Made in Mongolia" souvenirs

loans.name: Oijamol

texts.en:
G. Oijamol is an enterprising woman with a great desire of improving the quality of life of her family. She is the married mother of 5 children. Oijamol has been a seamstress since 1999. She sews traditional men’s coats, “Chapan”. With the support of her husband she was able to purchase a sewing machine 10 years ago and has been successful because her customers have recognized the high quality of her products. In this way, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow.

Today Oijamol is requesting a loan of 600 USD for a term of 12 months for purchasing supplies for her business. You can help improve the quality of life of her family. Oijamol and her son are grateful for your generosity and support.

loans.use: Purchasing the necessary supplies for sewing “Chapan”

loans.name: Khudoiberdi

texts.en:
H. Khudoiberdi is 54 years old. He is married and has 6 children. He is a very hard-working man who has experienced a great deal throughout his life. For the past 9 years, he has dedicated himself to providing taxi services. Regardless, Khudoiberdi is not regretful and is instead very proud of being a taxi driver. It is work where he can be free and make good friends, seeing as he is very charismatic. He always has a smile at the ready, and manages to bring out the same from those who ride in his taxi.

Happily for Khudoiberdi, business is good. It allows him to live comfortably, and support all of his children with education. Currently his car needs thorough repair and with this purpose he wants to borrow 500 USD for a term of 12 months that he will spend purchasing spare parts. He sincerely thanks Kiva and all lenders who make this help possible.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for thoroughly repairing his taxi

loans.name: Kudrat

texts.en:
J. Kudrat is 51 years old. He is married with 4 children. For more than 9 years, Kudrat has been working at house-repair. Kudrat is an example of the type of person who cannot sit by and do nothing. He started his house repair business to provide for his family. 

Firstly Kudrat started working as an apprentice. But gradually he has become an expert in this type of activity and now he has his own apprentices. Currently, he wishes to grow his business and improve his family's quality of life. Today Kudrat is requesting a loan of 800 USD, which he will use to purchase the necessary material for repairing houses in order to provide his high quality service and to be able to fulfill pending jobs and orders on time. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months. He and his family are very grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies

loans.name: Muharram

texts.en:
K. Muharram is a 30-year-old married mother of 5 children. For the past 2 years, Muharram has been helping her husband by earning money processing walnuts and selling them at the market. Muharram has applied for a loan of 800 USD to expand her operation. She wishes to buy more walnuts so she can earn more and improve her living conditions.

Muharram says that this is the perfect time for her to take out a loan. By offering a better selection, she knows she will be able to capitalize on this opportunity. Her goal is to continue expanding and improving her business every day, and more importantly, always to ensure that her five children will be able to attend a good school. Muharram is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve her dreams with this loan.

loans.use: Purchasing walnuts to process and sell

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
M. Jamila is a married mother of an enthusiastic family. She is a very hard worker, who rises early in the morning to feed her cattle. She wants to increase the set-up of her business to improve earnings. She works for the well-being and happiness of her 4 children. In order satisfy her goal for a higher quality of life, Jamila needs to buy more cattle for raising and later selling, for which she seeks a loan of 500 USD for a term of 12 months. Let’s support this hard-working and talented woman so that she can obtain her goals!

loans.use: Purchasing calves to raise and sell

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.en:
M. Mehriniso is a widowed mother with many overcoming wishes. She is an entrepreneur and this quality has allowed her to live comfortably and support herself and her dearest five children.

Mehriniso has opted to devote herself to the rearing of animals. At the same time, she is preparing to become a successful professional. She wishes to improve the rearing conditions in her small stable and for this reason, she is requesting a loan of $500 USD for a term of 12 months. She wishes with this loan to purchase two calves and trusts in your generous heart.

loans.use: To purchase two calves for rearing

loans.name: Gulafruz

texts.en:
S. Gulafruz is a woman who enjoys her work. She is in the animal-breeding business. Thanks to this business she can cover her family’s expenses and the educational expenses of her four children.

Gulafruz wishes to increase the number of animals she has in order to improve breeding. The sum that she needs is $600 USD which she guarantees will be properly invested. She is hoping for your support. Helping this woman achieve prosperity is in your hands.

loans.use: To increase the number of animals to improve breeding

loans.name: Tolib

texts.en:
S. Tolib, who lives in Pendjikent, Tajikistan, is dedicated to the cattle business to which he attends very diligently in his community. From very early in the morning he tends the animals and he returns in the afternoons, having been exposed to the sun and exhausted from all this. He does this in order to bring food to his table for his spouse and beloved four children. Tolib says that he works with only one aim in mind - to provide his children with a proper education.

Now, Tolib would like to expand his business and purchase two calves. For this purpose, he has applied for $400 USD and with your help he hopes to reach his aim. Be an important part of the growth of Tolib’s business.
