loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Yaya Absa's Group

texts.fr: Elles sont agées entre 25 et 30 ans leur activité principales est le commerce de détail.Pour s 'entre aider et se soutenir mutuellement elles ont crée une association dénommée takku liggey dialma1.Elles ont débuté leur commerce grace à une tontine .l argent de la tontine à permis à chacune d elle de démarrer une activité de commerce.Pour renforcer leur actité elles solicitent un pret.
texts.en:
These ladies are between 25 and 30 years of age and their primary business is petty trading. In order to help and support each other, they have created an association called Takku Liggey Dialma 1. They got themselves set up in business thanks to a revolving ("merry-go-round") loan plan. The money from that loan plan helped each one to set herself up in business. To bolster those businesses, they are requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Ashrab

texts.en:
S. Ashrab has been in the cattle-raising business since 2003. He has been able to support his family and his two grown children. All of his children are married and have their own families. Ashrab is requesting this loan in order to purchase more cows to increase his cattle inventory. He is aided by his wife who works with him in taking care of the cattle. His dream is to increase his current inventory so as to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: Purchase young cattle

loans.name: Chahbar

texts.en:
S. Chahbar is fifty years old, married, and has six children. He has a secondary education and has an animal husbandry business. He has a small barn where he breeds calves. Because he does not have a specialized education, animal husbandry is the only source of income for his family. Chahbar buys calves on the market at a low price, feeds them and then resells on the same market at a more profitable price. He provides the markets with meat and his family with the necessary food. Chahbar wants to buy a calf and needs money, so he decided to apply for a loan. He plans to pay off the loan within twelve months and will be very grateful to all those who can support him.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 
IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.en:
T. Nazokat is fifty-one years old. She is married, and uses all the money she makes to care for her four children and to provide for their education. Nazokat has three years of experience in preparing and selling walnuts. She always makes very creative use of her capital, adding inventory to her supply in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. She is also very polite and considerate, and her clients are always very happy with the service they receive from her. Because her business is doing so well, she is increasing her net worth month by month. Today Nazokat requests $800 for the term of twelve months. She is going to spend the loan on the purchase of walnuts with the purpose of processing them in order to increase her volume of sales. Nazokat expresses her gratitude to everyone for supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase more walnuts to sell

loans.name: Vali

texts.en:
U. Vali dedicates himself to the business of raising livestock. He distinguishes himself by having a lot of experience when it comes to livestock. He supports his spouse and four children and also provides for their education. It is important to note that thanks to his hard work he has been able to give his children his support so that they can get ahead. Vali is hoping for the assistance of IMON with the goal of obtaining a loan of $500. This will allow him to purchase young cattle to increase his herd, so as to earn more income. Both Vali and his loving family will benefit from this loan.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

loans.use: To purchase young cattle

loans.name: Saodathon

texts.ru: Абдуллоева Саодатхон проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст 31 год, женат и имеет троих детей. РАботает вместе с мужем. Имеет торговую точку , где торгует одеждой. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет ей завезти сезонный товар . Таким образом она  сможет развивать бизнес и получать прибыль уже в увеличенном размере.
texts.en:
Saodathon A. lives in the Varzob area. She is 31 years old, is married and has three children. She works together with her husband. She has a sales location where she sells clothing. Saodathon plans to take out a loan in order to increase her inventory. This will allow her to purchase seasonal products. This way she will be able to grow her business and increase her income.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing for sale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice A. is forty-eight years old and married with five children. She sells secondhand clothes and bags.  She is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more clothes and bags to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothes and bags to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. is 52 years old and married with 6 children. Esther sells foodstuffs. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Since 1994 Igor has been raising animals – cattle for milk and pigs for meat, and this is still the main activity of his small business. Beginning in 1999, he also is the owner of 2.18 ha of agricultural land and 0.4 ha of vineyard.

The loan requested from Microinvest will be used to acquire 2 more pigs and to purchase building materials for the repairing of the stable.

For the future, Igor plans to expand the activity of grape-growing.

loans.use: acquiring 2 more pigs and building materials for the repairing of the stable

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys N. is 53 years old and married with a child. She sells provisions. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet O. is a hair stylist and she also sells costume jewelry and salon materials like hair extensions, hair cream, etc. She is 36 years old and married with 4 children. She is requesting the loan amount of N 70,000 to purchase more jewelry and salon materials to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry and salon materials to sell

loans.name: Balogun

texts.en: Balogun A. is 39 years old and married with 4 children. He makes shoes of various sizes and colours for his customers. He is requesting the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more shoe materials to make more shoes to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoe materials to make more shoes to sell

loans.name: Olusoji

texts.en: Olusoji A. is 36 years old and married with 4 children. He sells VCDs retail to his customers. He is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000  to purchase more  VCDs to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more VCDs to sell

loans.name: Amoo

texts.en: Amoo A. is 53 years old and married with 3 children who are doing well in school; she sells hair extensions and hair creams. Her husband is a civil servant. She is requesting the loan amount of N 80,000 to buy more hair extensions and hair cream to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hair creams to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda Banez is a 50-year-old mother of ten. Her husband Numeriano is a farmer who works a two-hectare rice field. Rebecca barters (soft drinks and bread) in exchange for rice during harvest season. Her sons and daughters stopped schooling after their secondary education because of the scarcity of money to finance their college education. 

Rosalinda joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) to get capital to buy fertilizer, and to buy assorted foods for her bartering. She hopes that through her loan, she can purchase the inputs in bulk and in advance to get a lesser price in the market to avoid borrowing from usurious lenders. The couple hopes that with the loan extended to them they can save their harvest for the whole year's consumption.

loans.use: Tu buy farm inputs such as fertilizer,  and assorted foods for bartering

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola E. is 35 years old and married with 2 children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. She is requesting the loan amount of N 60,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther A. is 41 years old and married with 2 children. She sells medicines and provisions. She is requesting the loan amount of N 60,000 to purchase more medicines and provisions to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines and provisions to sell

loans.name: Omotoyosin

texts.en: Omotoyosin O. is 42 years old and married with 2 children. She sells and rents Video CDs. Her husband is a civil servant. Presently she plans to increase her sales and add the sale of clothes.   She is requesting the loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more Video CDs and clothes to sell. She says thanks to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more Video CDs and clothes to sell

loans.name: Odeola

texts.en: A. Odeola is 54 years old and married with 4 children.  She is a stylist. She has been in this business for a long time.  She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State.  She is requesting the loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase hair extensions and hair cream to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase hair extensions and hair cream to resell

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses A. A. is 45 years old, and married with 2 children. Moses sells ice-cream at wholesale and retail. He hopes to expand this business. He is requesting the loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more ice-cream to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ice-cream to sell

loans.name: Funyang

texts.en:
A mother of three and a widow, B. makes her living by working on her farm, growing beans and cassava year round.  This loan of 60,000 CFA will be her second from GHAPE and she plans to use the money to pay for the rent of her farmland, for the clearing and tilling of land, and to purchase bean seeds.

Having joined GHAPE in 2007, B. used her past loan for farming cassava, which helped pay her child's school fees.  Since she sells products that are needed in her community and has experience as a farmer, B. is confident that her farm will do very well.  She is also helping her neighbors by employing some to help clear and till the land.

Like her previous loan, this additional money will help B. provide food for her family, medical care when needed, and improve the way she lives her life in general.

B. has faced adversity in her life, like deaths in her family, sickness, and poverty, but with the help of GHAPE and Kiva, B. has persevered through her work on the farm. She also appreciates GHAPE because of the organization's gradual repayment plan and for providing training on how to manage a loan.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Rent of farmland, clearing and tilling land, purchase bean seeds

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 45 years old and married with 3 children. Mary sells drinks like Coca-Cola products and malt drinks. She hopes to have a bigger place and a fridge for cooling drinks. She is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lender.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Foyeke

texts.en: Fekoye O. is 47 years old and married with 4 children. She is a tailor and she also sells tailoring materials, shoes and bags. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials, bags and shoes to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials, bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El señor Víctor vive en casa propia en la Av. Entre Ríos 1436 de la zona oeste de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja como artesano, realizando joyas en oro y plata para personas particulares. Con esta actividad el puede cubrir sus necesidades y la manutención de su familia. El crédito que solicita será destinado a la compra de material en plata para incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2005  con créditos que  pagó puntualmente, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Victor lives in his own house on the Av. Entre Ríos 1436 in the zone west of the city of La Paz. He is an artisan who makes gold and silver jewelry for private individuals. With this business he can cover his necessities and the maintenance of his family. The loan will be used to buy silver materials to increase his income and improve his quality of life. He has been a customer of Improv since 2005. He has had loans and paid them back on time. This is why he can have access to a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy silver materials for his business of making jewelry for his customers.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet, 58 and married with six children, has sold palm oil for years. A client of LAPO, she is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more palm oil to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Feyisara

texts.en: Feyisara A. is 53 years old and married with 4 children. She sells drinks. She is requesting the loan amount of NGN 120,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El señor Félix vive en casa de sus padres en la calle pascual Mendoza de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja en la construcción de viviendas particulares. Con esta actividad el puede cubrir sus necesidades. El crédito que solicita será destinado a la construcción de un baño y la refacción de una cocina, para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2003  con créditos que  pagó muy puntualmente, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Félix lives in his parents’ house on Pascual Mendoza Street in the Villa Nuevo Potosí zone in the city of La Paz. He works in the construction of private housing. With this job he covers his necessities. The loan will be used to build a bathroom and to refurbish a kitchen in order to improve his living conditions. He has been a customer of Improv since 2003. He has had loans and paid them back on time. This is why he can have access to a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bathroom and refurbish the kitchen in his house.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah A., 44, is the married mother of four children, three of whom have completed senior high school and been working for a while. The last born is still in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the fishing community of Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. 
	
Hanna trades in vegetables such as peppers, tomatoes, and onions on a table top in the market square. She also sells foodstuffs such as yams and plantain, procuring her goods at effective prices from wholesalers and farmers in the nearby small communities. She says food vendors and other retailers normally purchase from her. Hannah has been in business for 15 years and is requesting a loan to procure goods in bulk.

loans.use: To procure vegetables and foodstuffs in bulk.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: La señora Bertha L. Q. y su esposo Esteban Gutiérrez, tienen tres pequeños hijos a quienes mantienen con su trabajo, mucha dedicación y cariño. Ellos viven en su domicilio de la Calle 9 en la zona Villa Tunari, en la ciudad de El Alto, departamento de La Paz. La señora Bertha y don Esteban se dedican a la venta de zapatillas deportivas (tenis) desde hace más de 14 años. Venden este producto en la Calle Sebastián Segurola (Barrio Chino) y en la Av. Ballivián de la zona, en la ciudad de El Alto; pero ellos no solo las venden, sino también, arreglan las zapatillas para su venta. El mayor deseo de ellos es poder darles a sus hijos una buena educación.Por esto y más la señora Bertha es considerada una cliente preferencial dentro de nuestra institución
texts.en:
Mrs. Bertha L. Q. and her husband, Esteban Gutiérrez, have three small children. They support their children through their work, much dedication, and affection. They live in their home on Calle 9, in the the Villa Tunari zone, in the city of El Alto, in the department of La Paz. Bertha and Esteban have been selling tennis shoes for more than 14 years. They sell their product on Calle Sebastián Segurola (Barrio Chino) and on the Av. Ballivián in the zone, in the city of El Alto. But, they do not just sell; they also repair shoes to be sold. Their biggest wish is to be able to give their children a good education. For this reason, among others, Bertha is considered a preferred customer within our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 5 dozen pairs of tennis shoes

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana E. is forty-four years old. She is married with three children. All of them are currently in school - senior and junior high schools. Joana lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

She trades rice to support her husband financially. She procures bags of rice from the wholesalers in the nearby cities at cost-effective prices. She sells the rice in cups in her community. Joana also sells on a table top in the market square. She says food vendors and other retailers normally purchase from her. Joana has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure more bags of rice to supply more customers.

loans.use: To purchase rice for resale

loans.name: Kuo Kuo Yuh

texts.en:
S. has been a member of GHAPE since 2007 and this loan will be his second from the organization.  S. is a multifaceted entrepreneur: he owns goats, bee hives for honey, and a photography studio.  This loan will be used to pay for the electricity for his studio and for the labor to upkeep his bee hives and goats.

Because all three of his areas of business are in constant demand, S. is confident his business will succeed, which ultimately helps the development of his small community.  Married, S. will then use the profits of the loan to further his three children's education, to provide any needs for the family and, lastly, to expand his businesses.

S. has faced some challenges in life, like the death of his mother, sickness and lack of education, but remains positive.  He has taken advantage of the training programs at GHAPE, like how to manage a loan, and appreciates the organization for its gradual repayment plan and for the closeness between  borrowers and staff.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Electricity for photo studio, labor for upkeep of bee hives and goats

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi E. is twenty-eight years old. She is married with one child who is currently in the basic school. She lives with her child and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Esi works to support her husband. She is a fish monger. She procures fresh fish from the fishermen in her community and smokes them herself. Esi distributes the smoked fish to the retailers in her community. She says food vendors also buy from her in bulk.

Esi has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure fish in bulk to increase her stock. Esi is hopeful to support her husband so that together they improve upon their standard of living.

loans.use: To procure fresh fish

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A., 23, sells drinks (malt, fan milk, fan ice, etc.) and meat pies in a shop by the roadside. She procures the drinks from the wholesale dealers in the regional capital, Cape Coast, and bakes the meat pies herself. In addition to the snacks business, Mary also sells phone credits.

This hard working young woman is single and lives independently. She says she wants to be financially secure before she enters into marriage. Mary lives alone in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure drinks in bulk and produce pies on a large scale.

loans.use: To buy drinks in bulk

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Greetings from Odette in Kabuga, Rwanda!  Odette is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company so that she may buy more stock for her hardware store.  She opened the business in 2005 and currently employs 2 people to assist her in running the shop.  She works daily from 6:00am to 6:30pm and earns a monthly profit of approximately 60 USD.  She is hoping that this loan will enable her to increase her profit so that she may build a house and more easily pay school fees for her children.  

Odette is 43 years old, married, and has five children and cares for one additional 23-year-old orphan.  Her children are aged 8, 10, 13, 17, and 19.  She is requesting a loan of 500,000 Rwandan Francs to be paid back over 12 months.

loans.use: To increase hardware store inventory

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy A., 29, married with two children, both of whom are still in the basic school, lives with her family in a rented apartment in Aquase in the Central Region of Ghana. Dorothy works as a hairdresser to support her husband financially. She owns a shop in her community where many women come daily to have their hair fixed, her busiest times being weekends. Dorothy says the clients like her services due to her skill, experience and good customer relations. 

In business for over five years and with a few apprentices training under her, she is requesting a loan to procure products such as shampoo, lotion, and artificial hair to improve upon her services.  She also sells phone credits in front of her shop.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, cream, artificial hair, etc

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Married with five children, Hilda is requesting a loan of about $175 to help her with her crop cultivation and goat rearing business. To cultivate her crops, it costs Hilda $110, and to purchase a goat and piglet, it is $33 each.  Hilda believes her business will continue to do well because she has all the necessary requirements: the land for the crops and the grass for her goat to feed on.  

Hilda’s business of farming and goat rearing helps her neighbors because she now provides manure and cassava.  In addition, by hiring the needed labor for her farm, she is helping strengthen her community. 

In the past, Hilda has faced some adversity in her life: health issues, lack of capital for her business to grow, and the inability to pay for providing educational opportunities for her five children. In fact, because of past illness problems, Hilda lost her left arm.  However, with this loan from Kiva lenders, Hilda remains positive and can use the profit to further her children’s education, to construct a bigger house and to purchase some much-needed housewares for her family.

Since January of 2008, Hilda has been a GHAPE member, and says that she has benefited from the easy repayment plans as well as the various training the organization provides.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community among its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To cultivate her crops and to purchase a goat and piglet

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Salina A. is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to four children. According to her, all of her four children are out of school and currently working for a while. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.
Salina works to support her husband financially in taking care of the family. She trades in fish. She sells both fresh fish and smoked fish. She buys fresh fish from the fishermen in her community and smokes some herself. She distributes the fish to the retailers and food vendors in her community. Mary wants a loan to buy fish in bulk so as to be able to supply more customers. She says food vendors also buy from her in bulk. She has been in business for three years.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Folake

texts.en: Folake is a hair stylist. She fixes and braids hair for people living in her area. She is thirty-one years old and married with three children. She is planning to sell drinks in her shop, and is requesting a loan of $550 to purchase a generator and refrigerators for selling cold drinks. She says thanks to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a generator and refrigerators

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Greetings from Josephine N. in Kabuga, Rwanda!  Josephine is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company so that she may increase her stock of shoes at her market stall.  She opened her stall eight months ago and works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm every day.  She earns approximately $60 in profit each month.  With her increased profits, Josephine intends to reinvest in her business so that it may continue to grow.  

Josephine is thirty-two years old, married, has seven children and cares for two other dependents.  Her children's ages are twelve, ten, seven, five and three, and she has eight-year-old twins.  The orphans for whom she cares are twelve and one month, respectively.  

Josephine is requesting a loan of $900 to be paid back on a monthly basis over an eight month period.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Kwaku

texts.en: Kwaku M. is forty years old. Kwaku is the name given to a Tuesday-born Akan male. He is married with five children. According to him, all of his children are in school. Some are in the basic school while others are in the junior high and senior high school. Kwaku lives with his children and wife in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. He is a trader. He deals in ready-made textiles and fabrics. He buys the goods at reduced prices and brings them all the way from Togo, a neighboring country. He hawks to sell his goods and treks to nearby towns as well. Kwaku has been in business for nine years and wants a loan to buy textiles in bulk to make more profit.

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is 39 years old and married with 6 children. He sells spare parts for motors and uses the profits to take care of his family. He is a LAPO client and has been in business for a long time. He is requesting the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more spare parts to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to resell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice A. is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to four children who are all still in school. Some of them are currently in the senior-high school while others are in the junior-high and basic schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Beatrice works hard to make some income to help her husband to provide for the family. Beatrice is a trader. She trades in provisions such as milk, sugar, candies, bread, etc. She procures the products from the wholesale dealers in the regional capital, Cape Coast, and sells in her community. Beatrice says she owns a shop in which she sells. She has been in business for nine years and wants a loan to buy more goods to stock her shop.

loans.use: To buy more goods to stock her shop

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana A. is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has three children who are all still in school. They are all in the basic school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Joana works hard to make some income to help her husband in providing for the family. She is a trader. She deals in provisions such as milk, sugar, candies, bread, etc. Joana procures the goods from the wholesale dealers in the regional capital, Cape Coast, and sells in her community. She says she owns the shop in which she sells her groceries. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan for more goods to stock her shop.

loans.use: For grocery store inventory

loans.name: Funke

texts.en:
Funke is 34 years old and married. She sells shoemaking materials like leather, etc. She has been in this business for a long time.

Funke is requesting a loan of N70,000 to purchase more shoemaking materials to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more shoemaking materials to sell

loans.name: Jenny Grisel

texts.es: La señora JENNY GRISEL S. A. y su esposo ERICK GUZMAN GONZALES, tienen un pequeño hijo a quienes mantienen con su trabajo. Ellos viven en su domicilio de la calle  ángel Sandoval # 1524  en la zona Calama, en la ciudad de El Alto. La señora Jenny se dedica a la venta de humintas y anticuchos; la huminta es una empanada tradicional de la zona occidental de Bolivia esta compuesta de choclo y queso; el anticucho esta compuesto de corazon de vaca, papa y maní (cacahuate), ensartados en un alambre. La señora sale todos los días  a la venta de sus productos, la elaboracion de las humintas las realizaba manualmente moliendo con la presion de un combo pero ahora con la compra de su moledora lo realizara eléctricamente. El mayor deseo de ellos es poder darle a su hijo una buena educación para que en un futuro sea una persona  de bien y responsable.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jenny Grisel S. A. and her husband Erick Guzman Gonzales have a young son whom they work to support. They live in their home at 1534 Angel Sandoval street, in the Calama neighborhood of the city of El Alto. Jenny sells humintas and anticuchos. A huminta is a traditional empanada from the western part of Bolivia and is made with corn and cheese. Anticuchos are skewers with cow's heart, potato and peanuts. Jenny goes out to sell her products every day. She used to make the humintas by hand, grinding them with the force of a wooden mallet, but now she has purchased an electric mill to grind them. The greatest hope of Jenny and Erick is to be able to give their child a good education so that he will grow up to be a good and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and an electric grinder

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah K. is fifty years old. She is married with seven children. Currently, only the last-born is in the junior-high school. The rest have all completed the senior-high school and have been working for a while. Sarah lives with her children and husband in a family house in a fishing-dominated community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Sarah works to support her husband financially. She is a trader and trades in jewelry. She procures jewelry such as earrings, necklaces, wristwatches, etc. from Cape Coast, the regional capital. Sarah says she hawks to houses to sell her goods in her community. She also treks to other markets to sell on their market days.

Sarah has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure a variety of jewelry in bulk to increase her stock. She is hoping to help her husband sponsor their children to further education.

loans.use: To procure a variety of jewelry in bulk to increase her stock

loans.name: Damien

texts.en:
Greetings from Damien M. in Kigali, Rwanda! Damien is currently seeking his first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more rice and sugar for his general store. He has owned his business for six years and has two employees who help him at the shop. He works daily from 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., earning approximately $500 before expenses each month.

Damien is 34 years old, married, and has two children and two dependents. He is seeking a loan of 300,000 Rwandan Francs to be paid back on a monthly basis over 8 months.

loans.use: To purchase rice and sugar for his general store

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama H. is a 47-year-old married mother of seven children. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in the fishing community of Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. One of her children has recently finished school and is now working, but the others are still in education – senior high, junior high and primary school.

Mariama is an experienced food vendor, and has been selling kenkey in her local community for 20 years. Kenkey is a dish prepared from maize (corn dough) and served hot with pepper and fried fish. Mariama prepares the kenkey at home and sells it by the roadside in the evenings. She buys the raw materials such as maize, fish, and vegetables from the local market. Mariama is requesting a loan to procure her raw materials in bulk. Her hope is to be able to support her children so that they can further their education.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Greetings from Chantal M. in Kigali, Rwanda! Chantal is 33 years old, married, and has four children (aged 13, 10, 7, and 5 months) and four dependants. 

Chantal is requesting her first loan from Kiva partner, Vision Finance Company, so that she can buy more clothing to sell from her market stall. She has been in business for ten years and has one employee in her shop. She works daily from 7am to 5pm. Chantal is requesting a loan of 500 000 RWF to be repaid on a monthly basis over an eight-month period.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
H. has recently completed her first loan from Kiva partner, GHAPE, and is now ready to take out her second loan for 50 000 XAF for her business of cultivating corn and making corn beer. To purchase 150kg of corn, it costs H. 30 000 XAF, and seeds to cultivate her crops cost 20 000 XAF. H. is confident that her business will continue to do well because she has a large customer base and is an expert in the production of corn beer!

Like many of her fellow borrowers, H. has faced many challenges in her life, such as health problems and deaths in her family, but with this loan she remains positive about her business prospects. She plans to use the profits to pay her only child’s school fees, to expand her business, and to start building a house for her family.  

H. is appreciative of GHAPE and Kiva for providing her with a loan. She enjoys being a member of GHAPE because of the training programs (e.g. on how to keep families healthy), the manageable repayment plan, and the opportunity to be around the other members, which she loves!

More about GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff, and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy seeds and corn

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba M. is a 38-year-old married mother of five children who are all currently in school, either junior high or basic school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in the fishing community of Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Aba works as a fishmonger to earn some income to support her husband. She procures fresh fish from the fishermen in her community and smokes them herself. She then distributes the smoked fish to local retailers and food vendors. Aba has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure fish in bulk to increase her stock. With the profits she makes, Aba wants to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure fresh fish

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: El señor  VICTOR C. S. y su esposa JUANA COLQUE, tienen tres pequeños hijos a quienes mantienen con su trabajo. Ellos viven en su domicilio de la calle  José Ballivián # 5181  en la zona Villa Juliana ciudad de El Alto. El don VICTOR tiene la profesión de mecánico que realiza en su mismo domicilio y su señora se dedica al las labores de casa, el Sr. Víctor aprendió esa profesión de su padre que desde pequeño fue enseñándole. El destino del credito es la compra de un vehiculo, el cual sera desarmado para asi tener repuestos a otras movilidades. El mayor deseo de ellos es poder darles a sus hijos una buena educación.
texts.en:
Mr. Victor C. S. and his wife Juana Colque have three small children whom they support. They live in their home at #5181 José Ballivián street in the Villa Juliana neighborhood of the city of El Alto. Victor is a mechanic who works out of his home and his wife is a homemaker. Victor began learning his profession at a very young age, taught by his father. This loan is for the purchase of a vehicle which will be stripped for parts that can then be used as replacements in other vehicles. Victor and Juana's greatest desire is to be able to give their children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a vehichle that can be stripped for replacement parts

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi E. is a 52-year-old married mother of five children. Her eldest three children have finished their schooling and are now working, whilst the younger two are currently in school – senior high and junior high. Esi lives with her family in the fishing community of Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Esi trades in assorted utensils that she procures from wholesalers in the nearby big towns, especially Cape Coast, the regional capital. She also sells textiles. Esi trades in the market square and hawks as well. She has been in this business for five years and now aspires to increase her stock so she can trek to other towns to sell. Her loan will be used to purchase more goods.

loans.use: To buy cooking utensils

loans.name: Kwaku

texts.en:
Kwaku N. is fifty-four years old. Kwaku is the name given to a Tuesday born Akan male. He is a married man and the father of four children. According to him, the first three of his children are out of school and the last-born is in the junior-high school. He also has one stepchild. He lives with his children and wife in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Kwaku is a carpenter by profession. He is into furniture making and the building of cargo car bodies. He procures hardwood that serves this purpose from sawmills in the nearby towns. Kwaku makes the furniture and places it by the roadside for sale. He has been in the carpentry business for nineteen years now and wants a loan to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his carpentry business

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew M. is fifty years old. He is married with three children. One of them is out of school and currently working. Two of them are in the senior-high school. He lives with his children and wife in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Andrew is hardworking man. He is a trader and deals in cosmetics. Andrew procures cosmetics such as body sprays, powder, creams, etc., and hawks to sell in the community he lives in. He also treks to other markets to sell on the market days.

Andrew has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure a variety of cosmetics in bulk. Andrews is hoping to give his children the best education he can afford.

loans.use: To buy a variety of cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
La Sra. Trinidad T.  C. vive en casa propia que recien la construyo con juntamente el esposo, quien trabaja como mensajero en una institucion privada, ellos tienen tres hijos , dos en edad escolar y un pequeño de 8 meses, la señora se dedica a parte de administrar su transporte a repartir ropa y viveres a los vecinos de la zona, aunque ese trabajo lo realiza esporádicamente.
Ella trabajo con credito desde el año 2004, conformando el grupo Nayampis de tres integrantes,  en siete secuencias; posteriormente, se individualizo, este es su tercer credito que invertira en mantenimiento del transporte y en arreglo del patio de su vivienda.
La Sra. Trinidad T. es una cliente que cumple con su pagos regularmente y demuestra interes en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Trinidad T. C. lives in her own home which she recently built with her husband. He is a messenger at a private company. They have 3 children: two who are school-aged, and an 8 month old. Trinidad also uses her vehicle to deliver clothing and food to neighbors in her area, although this work is sporadic. She has been working with loans since 2004, first putting together the Nayampis group with three people who had seven sequences. Later, she took out an individual loan. This is her third loan which will be used for vehicle maintenance and to fix the patio of her home. Mrs. Trinidad T. is a customer who makes regular payments and shows interest in her work.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance and home repair

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to five children. She says three of her children have completed senior high school and are currently working. The last two are still in school. Mary lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Mary is a hardworking woman. She is a bread baker. She bakes bread and supplies it to retailers and beverage sellers in her community. Mary also sells drinks such as malt, Fanta, Coke, etc. She procures the drinks from the wholesale dealers in the regional capital, Cape Coast.

Mary has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure more bags of flour, ingredients and drinks in bulk to produce bread on large scale.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour, ingredients and drinks in bulk to produce bread on a large scale

loans.name: Naana

texts.en:
Naana K. is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to four children. One of them is currently in the senior high school. Another is learning a trade while the others are in the junior high school and the basic school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Naana works to make some income to support her husband. She trades in fish. She procures fresh fish from the fishermen in her community and sells at the local market. She distributes some to the retailers in her community and also supplies to food vendors.

Naana has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure fish in bulk to increase her stock. She desires to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure fresh fish in bulk

loans.name: Isora

texts.es: Isora tiene 26 años, vive con su pareja y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Ella es propietaria de un motocarro, con el que su pareja se dedica al transporte público de pasajeros por la ciudad de Pucallpa, mientras que Isora administra las ganancias diarias de este negocio. Adicionalmente, vende ropa de casa en casa, al contado y al crédito, por su localidad y zonas aledañas. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es sentirse útil frente a la sociedad y además le es rentable, tanto su motocarro, como la venta de ropa le generan buenos ingresos, los cuales le ayudan a fortalecer la economía de su hogar. Con MFP ya tiene 8 préstamos, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son puntuales en sus pagos, y nota que todos son muy unidos al momento de resolver algún problema. Con el dinero que ahora está solicitando, Isora mandará a reparar las fallas de su motocarro, por un costo de 1000 soles; con el resto comprará más prendas de vestir para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Isora is 26 years old and lives with her partner and their two children in their own home. She is the owner of a motorcar with which her partner offers public transportation for passengers around the city of Pucallpa while Isora administers the daily profits of the business. Additionally, she sells linens from her home for cash or on credit in her area and in bordering areas. What she likes about her job is that it makes her feel useful in society and it is profitable as is her motorcar. The sale of the linens generate good profits which help to strengthen the household economy. She already has 8 loans with MFP and she likes to work with the communal bank because all of the members are punctual with their payments. It is noteworthy that all of the members are very united to fix any problems. With the money that she is now requesting, Isora will send in her motorcar for repairs for at a cost of 1000 soles with the rest of the money she will buy more articles of clothing to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her motorcar / Reparación de su motocarro

loans.name: Manos Juntas Rumichaca Alta Group

texts.es:
El grupo “MANOS JUNTAS RUMICAHACA ALTA”; Tiene 14 miembros activos, en su mayoría son nacidos en el distrito D. Rumichaca, está situado a 15 minutos D. la provincia D. Urubamba en el departamento del Cusco.

Estos socios están en su etapa inicial con este banco comunal, tienen entre sus actividades la agricultura, la ganadería y la artesanía, alternando sus actividades domésticas y en la mayoría D. los casos estás actividades son heredadas D. generación en generación, por lo que ellos requieren el préstamo, para poder comprar sus productos agrícolas (semillas, maíz, cebada), en la ganadería (animales menores cuyes, aves D. corral y animales vacunos), en cuanto a los que se dedican a la artesanía, requieren comprar materia prima (arcilla, maquinaría y otros).

Los socios del banco se encuentran muy agradecidos y expresan sus saludos, valorando este préstamo por lo que se comprometen a cumplir con sus obligaciones D. pago en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
This loan group, Manos Juntas (Hands Together) Rumichaca Alta, has 14 active members most of whom were born in the District of Rumichaca, which is situated about 15 minutes from Urubamba Province in the Department of Cusco. These members are in their first stage with this communal bank. Their activities incluD. agriculture and livestock in addition to their usual domestic chores, and for most of them these activities have been passed down from generation to generation. They are requesting this loan so as to be able to buy their supplies for agriculture (seeds, corn, barley) and animal husbandry (young guinea pigs, poultry, cattle) and raw materials for those engaged in hand crafts (clay, machinery and such). The bank members are very grateful and send their regards. They are taking this loan very seriously and promise to fulfill their obligations to repay it according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for farming and handcrafts.

loans.name: Maria Maxima

texts.es:
La Señora Maxima S. se dedica a la venta D. diferentes tipos D. masas, pasteles y otros hace tres años cuando se retiro D. Enfermera, es cliente en  tercera secuencia recomendada por otra cliente antigua D. la zona, ella tiene la unica reposteria D. la zona y es conocida por el agradable sabor que le da a los productos que venD.. Sus principales productos que elabora son: tortas, alfajores, empanadas, etc. 
La cliente muestra ser muy responsable en sus pagos.
Actualmente ella  trabaja, ocasionalmente, como enfermera con pacientes D. la tercera edad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maxima S. started selling pastries three years ago, when she retired from a career in nursing. She was originally recommended by another client in the area, and this is her third loan cycle. Maxima has the only bakery in her neighborhood and is well known for the delicious flavors of her products. Her primary products are cakes, tarts, and empanadas. Maxima has shown herself to be very responsible in her repayments. She now occasionally also works as a nurse for senior citizens.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour and other ingredients for the bakery

loans.name: Fabiola Kruscaya

texts.en:
Fabiola is the president of the “Juntos de la Mano” (“Holding hands”) Village Bank. She is 29 years old and is the single mother of a two-year-old daughter.

Fabiola sells dry goods like grains, flour, and dried beans and corn from a small grocery store she runs in Anta, a town about 40 minutes outside of the city of Cusco. She recently opened the store in a rented location; before then, she worked from a smaller stand. Fabiola works seven days a week at her store from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. She usually works alone, though sometimes her goddaughter helps her, as does the father of her daughter.

Fabiola is requesting a loan of 1500 soles to stock her new store. She still has to take inventory, so she isn’t sure exactly what products she will need to buy yet. She has pledged to repay her Kiva loan on time and in full.

Fabiola’s goal for the future is to open her own large supermarket.

loans.use: To stock her recently opened small grocery store

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Juntos de la Mano (“Holding Hands”) Village Bank. She is 51 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom are now adults. Four of her five children are married and have children of their own, while her youngest daughter is still single.

Victoria runs a butcher shop in a rented space in Anta, a town about forty minutes outside of the city of Cusco. She works seven days a week, from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. She usually works alone, though sometimes her daughters help out. Victoria has sold meat for the past twenty years. She sells about 1500 soles (US$476) worth of meat each day, of which 80-100 soles (US$25-$32) is profit.

Victoria needs a loan of 1500 soles to buy beef, lamb, pork and alpaca meat. She has pledged to repay her Kiva loan on time and in full. Her goal for the future is to build a small barn in which to raise pigs and guinea pigs.

loans.use: Buy beef, lamb, pork and alpaca meat for her butcher shop

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La socia del banco comunal es la sra. ANDREA; ella es natural de la provincia de Calca, la socia tiene 58 años de edad y tiene 8 hijos, de los cuales ella vive actualmente con el menor de 14 años de edad y aún lo educa.

Nuestra socia tiene entre sus actividades domésticas, el comercio de venta de comida en el mercado central, ella tiene un pequeño espacio en el cual ha puesto un restaurante al paso, vende sopa de verduras, sopa de gallina y otros platos; Ella solicitó el préstamo, para poder implementar su negocio y comprar insumos para el mes al por mayor tales como, arroz. Aceite, sal y otros.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete en el pago total del mismo en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
Andrea is a member of the community bank and is from Calca province. She is 58 years old and has 8 children, the youngest of whom, aged 14, she lives with and still teaches.

As well as her domestic responsibilities, Andrea runs a business selling food in the central market. She has a small area where she has set up a takeaway restaurant, selling vegetable soup, chicken soup and other dishes. She is asking for a loan for her business so she can buy what she needs for the month at the wholesalers, such as rice, oil, salt, etc.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to repay it in full and on time.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products from the wholesalers for her takeaway restaurant business.

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.es:
La socia CELEDONIA; es natural del distrito de Calca, en la provincia de Urubamba, nuestra socia tiene 49 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo de 20 años. 

Nuestra socia Celedonia, alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio de venta de abarrotes, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, para lo cual requiere el préstamo para su debida implementación, y de este modo seguir apoyando en los estudios superiores de su hijo.

La socia valora y agradece el apoyo otorgado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de la deuda en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
The partner CELEDONIA is native of the district of Calca, in the province of Urubamba. Our partner is 49 years old, she is a single mother of a 20-year-old son. Our partner Celedonia, alternates her domestic activities with selling groceries. She has a small grocery store, for this reason she needs the loan for its due set up, and this way to keep on supporting her son with his studies. The partner values and is grateful for the support granted by all the kiva members and she promises to repay the loan in time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to set up her grocery store.

loans.name: Ketty

texts.es: Ketty tiene 27 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos, vive junto a su esposo, quien le apoya y está de acuerdo con sus objetivos de negocio. Ambos viven en la casa que con mucho esfuerzo pudieron conseguir. Ambos se dedican a la venta de madera trabajada, su esposo es el encargado de comprar la madera en bruto y llevarla a un aserradero para que la dejen lista la venta, mientras ella, administra el negocio y se contacta con los clientes. Con esta actividad ya tienen laborando un periodo de 4 años, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se relaciona con muchas personas. Lo bueno de este negocio, y por lo que es rentable, es que cuenta con clientes fieles que le comprar periódicamente, además de satisfacer los pedidos de carpinterías de otras provincias. El deseo de Ketty para el futuro es comprar maquinarias de aserradero (cortadoras, sierras, entre otros). Con MFP ya tiene 3 préstamos, su banco comunal se llama “Las Palmas”, y le gusta trabajar con este grupo porque considera que son personas responsables, que si se presenta un problema, buscan resolverlo lo antes posible, en vez de hacerlo más grave. Ketty invertirá el dinero que ahora solicita en la compra de más madera.
texts.en:
Ketty is 27 years old, has 2 children, and lives with her husband, who helps her and agrees with her business goals. They live together in the home that they acquired with a lot of effort and strength. They both sell treated wood—her husband is in charge of buying the untreated wood and taking it to a sawmill to prepare it for sale. Ketty runs the business and communicates with their customers. They have been working in this business for the past 4 years and like it because they get to interact with many people. The good part about this job, and the reason that it is profitable, is that they have loyal customers who buy their wood. They also fill orders from carpenters from other states. In the future, Ketty hopes to buy sawmill machines (cutting machines, saw, etc). This is her third loan with MFP and her community bank is called “Las Palmas.” She enjoys working with this group because she believes they are responsible people, and if there is a problem, they all try to solve the problem as quickly as possible, instead of making it worse. Ketty will use this money to purchase more wood.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: wood

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “Juntos de la Mano” (“Holding Hands”) Village Bank. She is 36 years old and married with six children. Her oldest daughter is 22, while her youngest son is just 14 months old (pictured).

Maria sells electronics on the street in the town of Anta, about forty minutes outside the city of Cusco. She sells mostly radios, stereos, TVs, cameras, and flashlights, as well as small household appliances like blenders. She has been in this line of work for the past two years. Maria works seven days a week, from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. She usually sells about 300-800 soles (US $95-$254) of merchandise each day, of which about 20% is profit. Maria’s husband runs a photo services store in Anta, and her oldest daughter has a photo services / call center locale in the capital city of Lima, about twenty hours from Anta.

Maria is requesting a loan of 1500 soles to buy more small electronics to sell. She has pledged to repay her Kiva loan in full and on time. Her goal for the future is to expand her husband’s business and open stores in Quillabamba and Abancay, two major cities within eight hours of Anta.

loans.use: To buy more small electronics to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a member of the “Juntos de la Mano” (“Holding Hands”) Village Bank. She is 63 years old and widowed with six children. All of her children are adults, though her two youngest still live at home with her. Cristina sells tools and hardware items at a stand at the market in the town of Anta, located about forty minutes outside of Cusco. She has been in this line of work for about ten years. Cristina works seven days a week from 6am to 8pm, and sells about 120-150 soles’ worth of merchandise per day.

Cristina is requesting a loan of 1,500 soles to invest in her business to buy hammers, nails, screws, and other tools. She has pledged to repay her Kiva loan in full and on time. Cristina’s dream is to continue working for many more years. She is pictured below with her two-year-old granddaughter, who accompanied her to her loan disbursal meeting.

loans.use: Buy hammers, nails and other hardware items.

loans.name: Mercedes Elena

texts.es: La sra. Mercedes se dedica a la venta de rellenos en un pequeño snack ubicado cerca del mercado 10 de Enero,en la populosa zona de Pampahasi desde hace 5 años, trabajó en la institución en febrero del año pasado, y ahora vuelve, vive en su propia casita con su papá. Es una persona muy conocida por la zona. Invertirá el crédito en la compra de víveres para la preparación de los rellenos, es una comida tipica que se sirve, generalmente, en las mañanas. Los insumos que utilizan son: harina, papa, platano de cocinar, carne y verduras; todo esto va acompañado de diferentes ensaladas de verduras.
texts.en:
Mercedes makes and sells rellenos, (a popular bolivian snack made with meat and mashed potatoes) from a small snack stand located near the 10 de enero market in the populated region of Pampahasi. She has worked there for the past 5 years. She worked for an institution in February but has returned and lives in her own home with her father. She is a well-known person in the area. She will invest the loan money in supplies to make the rellenos, a food that is typically served in the morning. The ingredients that she needs are: flour, potatoes, bananas, meat and vegetables. All of this is accompanied by different types of vegetable salads.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Flour and pototes at a wholesale price

loans.name: Ruth Mirim

texts.en:
Ruth is the Secretary of the “Juntos de la Mano” (“Holding Hands”) Village Bank; she is pictured below with the group's official Book of Records, which she is in charge of. She is 31 years old and is separated with two children, who are 11 and 15 years old.

Ruth buys and sells livestock like pigs and cows. She buys the animals from farmers, slaughters them, and sells the meat to market vendors. She has been in this line of work for many years; her mother also buys and sells livestock. Ruth works six to seven days per week, depending on the volume of business, which varies from day to day. She travels to nearby farms to pick up the animals on a rental truck, then takes the cows to the slaughterhouse and slaughters the pigs herself at home.

Ruth is requesting a loan of 1500 soles to buy more livestock. She still isn’t quite sure whether she will buy pigs or a cow; pigs cost 300-1200 soles, depending on their weight, and cows cost 1200-2200 soles. She plans to survey the animals available before she makes her decision. Ruth has pledged to repay her Kiva loan in full and on time. Her goal for the future is to open a butcher shop in Cusco to exclusively sell pork.

loans.use: Buy a cow or pigs.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy tiene 37 años, vive junto a su pareja, y actualmente está a la espera de su primer hijo. Se dedica a la venta de variedades de plásticos; durante las mañanas lo hace en un puesto de un mercado de su localidad, y por las tardes lleva a vender a las diferentes tiendas que se encuentran por su zona. Este trabajo lo viene ejerciendo desde hace un año atrás en forma permanente, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja, pues trabajan juntos. A Lucy le gusta mucho su trabajo porque conoce muchos lugares y se socializa, además que le es rentable porque tiene su propia clientela y sus productos se vende diariamente. Su plan para un futuro cercano es acondicionar un lugar en su casa para la venta de su mercadería y dejar de pagar alquiler. Con este, ya son 7 préstamos que Lucy viene trabajando con MFP, su banco comunal se llama “Las Palmas”, al cual le gusta pertenecer porque hay mucha comprensión y responsabilidad entre todos los integrantes. Con el dinero que ahora solicita, mandará a construir el local que tanto desea en su casa para poner su negocio, para lo que gastará 1500 soles; con el resto comprará mayor cantidad de productos plásticos en diferentes variedades.
texts.en:
Lucy is 37 years old and lives with her common-law husband and she is currently pregnant with their first child. She sells various types of plastic; during the mornings she sells from a stand in her local market and in the afternoons she sells to different stores in her area. She has worked full-time in this job for the past year and she works together with her husband. Lucy likes her job because she gets to visit a lot of places and socialize. It is also profitable because she has her own group of customers and she sells her products each day. Her short-term plan is to prepare a space in her home to sell her products from so she can stop paying rent (in the market). This is Lucy’s 7th loan with MFP. Her community bank is called “Las Palmas” and she enjoys being a member because there is a lot of compassion and responsibility among all of the members. With the loan money, she will begin building the space in her home that she has been hoping for, a place to have her business. She will spend 1,500 soles on that and the rest will b used to buy more types of plastic.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: build a place for her business

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee is a member of the “Juntos de la Mano” (“Holding Hands”) Village Bank. She is 36 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two children, who are 12 and 6 years old. Haydee sells chicken and fish in the market in Anta, a small town about forty minutes outside of the city of Cusco. She has been in this business for the past eight years. The meat is brought in on trucks from Cusco to Anta, an improvement from previous years, when Haydee had to personally travel to Cusco to buy meat. She works seven days a week from 6am to 7pm, and sells about 800 soles’ worth of meat per day from her stand, of which 8%-10% is profit.

Haydee is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy fish and seafood for Holy Week, a major holiday in predominately Catholic Peru. She has pledged to repay her Kiva loan on time and in full. Haydee’s dream for the future is to buy a plot of land on which to build a house for her family.

loans.use: Buy fish and seafood.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela cuenta con 27 años de edad, tiene una hija preciosa de 2 añitos, y vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Durante el día, Mariela trabaja en una institución muy reconocida de su región, al terminar esta labor se dedica a la venta ropa y zapatos al crédito o al contado, cuando tiene pedidos de sus  clientes o de personas con las que tendrá un contacto seguro, opta por dejarles pagar en partes, y según el tiempo convenido, las busca en sus casas o centros de trabajo para cobrarles. La idea de emprender este negocio, surgió a raíz de querer incrementar los ingresos económicos  para su hogar, de esto hace ya 5 años. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce a mucha gente y su gama de clientes aumenta, por lo que le es rentable, además sólo trabaja a pedido, así no pierde en comprar mercadería que demore vender o no venda. Posteriormente, Mariela quiere tener una tienda de ropa y zapatos de mejor calidad. Con MFP ya tiene 3 préstamos, y lo que más le gusta de trabajar y pertenecer a su banco  comunal es que todos los integrantes son organizados. Con el dinero que en esta ocasión solicita, comprará la ropa y zapatos de los pedidos que hasta el momento tiene.
texts.en:
Mariela is 27 years old and has a cute little daughter who is 2 years old. She and her husband live in their own home. During the day, Mariela works for a well-known institution in the area. After that she works selling clothes and shoes. When she has orders from her customers or from people that she knows, she lets them buy on credit and make payments to her. When the payment date arrives, she goes to their houses or workplaces to collect her money. She got the idea to start this business five years ago, when she wanted to increase her home’s income. What she likes most about her job is getting to know many people and her client base is increasing. It is profitable for her because she only sells by the order, so she doesn’t waste money on merchandise that will not sell. In the future, Mariela would like to have a store that sells clothing and high-quality shoes. This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she enjoys working with her community bank because all of the members are very organized. With the loan money she will by clothes and shoes to fill the orders that she has right now.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase merchandise

loans.name: Merly

texts.es: Merly tiene 36 años, es madre de 2 hijos y vive con su esposo, quien la apoya mucho en su negocio. Esta familia vive en su casa propia. Ella es propietaria de un motocarro, herramienta con la que trabajan su esposo e hijos, turnándose como choferes para realizar transporte de pasajeros por la ciudad de Pucallpa (región de selva peruana); mientras que Merly administra las ganancias. Adicionalmente, desde hace 3 años, durante casi todo el día vende periódicos; y por las noches vende comida en la puerta de su casa. Merly se siente contenta, porque no se le han presentado grandes dificultades con ninguno de sus negocios; y en todos, recibe ganancias diarias, con lo que sustenta las necesidades de la familia. Además, también le gusta que tanto su esposo, como sus hijos, juntos, sean instrumento del progreso del hogar, lo que dice no ver en otras casas. Merly tiene 7 préstamos con MFP, su banco comunal se llama “Las Palmas”, al cual le gusta pertenecer porque sus integrantes son coordinados y todos se apoyan mutuamente. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en sus tres negocios. Con 500 soles comprará gran cantidad de periódicos para aumentar sus ventas, con otros 500 soles reparará las fallas de su motocarro y con el resto comprará víveres e ingredientes para la preparación de la comida que vende por las noches.
texts.en:
Merly is 36 years old, the mother of two children and lives with her husband who helps her greatly with her business. This family lives in their own house. She is the owner of a motorcycle taxi, which vehicle her husband and children take turns operating as chauffeurs transporting passengers around the city of Pucallpa, in the Peruvian Amazon region. Merly, meanwhile, handles the finances. In addition, for the last three years she spends most of the day selling newspapers and in the evenings she sells meals from the entrance to her house. Merly feels content because she has not faced great difficulties with any of her businesses and they all make money daily which she uses to meet the needs of her family. Furthermore, she likes that together with her husband and children they are the instruments of progress for their family, which she says she does not always see in other households. Merly has had seven loans with Microfinanzas PRISMA. Her Communal Bank is called "Las Palmas" and she likes belonging to it because her colleagues are organized and they all support one another. The funds she is requesting this time will be invested in her three businesses. She will use 500 Sols to buy a large quantity of newspapers to increase her sales, another 500 Sols will be used to make some repairs to her taxi, and the rest will be used to buy supplies and ingredients to prepare the evening meals that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair her moto-taxi and purchase merchandise for her other businesses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy two head of cattle

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita tiene 37 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos y vive junto a su esposo. Se dedica a la venta de periódicos ambulatoriamente, éstos los lleva a vender por los diferentes lugares de su localidad. En esta labor lleva un periodo de 10 años y su esposo la apoya mucho, cada vez que tiene momentos libres para hacerlo. Lo que a Rita le gusta de su trabajo es que se relaciona con muchas personas, con quienes ya tiene mucha confianza y se convierten en sus fieles clientes, por lo que su actividad se convierte en un negocio rentable, además que los periódicos es una mercadería que se vende por sí sola. Posteriormente, Rita quiere tener un kiosco estable y trabajar más descansada, sin tener que caminar por las calles bajo el ardiente sol o la torrencial lluvia de la ciudad de Pucallpa. Con MFP, ya tiene 6 préstamos, y lo que más le gusta de ser parte de su banco comunal es que todos los integrantes son unidos y actúan sin egoísmos. El dinero que en esta ocasión solicita es para comprar una moto, para entregar los periódicos con mayor facilidad, para esto gastará 2000 soles. Con los 500 restantes adquirirá mayor cantidad de más periódicos.
texts.en:
Rita is 37, has 3 children, and lives with her husband. She sells newspapers on foot. She takes them to sell in different places in her town. She has been doing this for 10 years, and her husband helps her a lot whenever he has the free time to do so. What Rita likes about her work is that she meets lots of people. These people have confidence in her and have become her loyal customers. This, and the fact that she works for herself, have made her business profitable. Later, Rita would like to have a stable kiosk. Then she would be more rested when she works and not have to walk the streets under the burning sun or the torrential rain in the city of Pucpallpa. She has had 6 loans with MFP. The thing she likes the best about being part of her community bank is that all of the members are so united and unselfish. The loan is to buy a motorcycle in order to deliver the newspapers more easily. This would cost 2000 PEN. With the remaining 500 PEN she would get more newspapers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 61 años, es viuda desde hace 7 años, y vive con su hija que es madre soltera. Desde la muerte de su esposo, empezó a dedicarse a la venta de ropa de segundo uso que  lleva a vender por los distintos lugares de su zona y algunos caseríos que se encuentran a tres días de viaje por el río Ucayali (principal río de la ciudad de Pucallpa). Las prendas que Rosa vende, en su mayoría las deja al crédito por lo que regresa cada cierto tiempo a las casas de sus clientes para realizar las respectivas cobranzas. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que hace nuevas amistades, y durante sus ventas mantiene muy amenas conversaciones con sus clientes. Pero lo más importante, es que mediante esta actividad está progresando económicamente, lo que repercute en la mejora de su economía. Desde que empezó a trabajar con MFP, ha accedido a 5 préstamos, y este es el número 6. Del cual, invertirá todo el monto en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 61 years old and has been a widow for 7 years. She lives with her daughter who is a single mother.

Since the death of her husband, Rosa has sold secondhand clothing around her area and in a few villages 3 days’ journey away along the Ucayali river (the main river in Pucallpa). Rosa sells most of the clothing on credit, which is why she returns to her customers’ homes from time to time to receive payment.

What she likes about her work is making new friendships and the good conversation she has with her customers. But, more importantly, this work has improved her economic situation.

Since she started working with MFP, she has received 5 loans; this will be number 6. She will use the money to purchase a larger quantity of merchandise for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy seafood (Shrimp, scallops, fish, squid and snails)

loans.name: Donald Antonio

texts.es: Donald Antonio es casado, es pequeño productor que junto a su papá se dedican a la produccion de arroz secano y de riego, este rubro productivo les permite garantizar el sustento familiar (4 hermanos menores y su mamá y compañera), ya que actualmente convive con sus padres.  Diariamente muy temprano le dedican la atencion requerida al cultivo y asi garantizar sus cosechas. Actualmente esta solicitando financiamiento para participar como socio en la construccion de un trillo arrocero en su comunidad, lo que le permitira obtener mayores utilidades en sus ciclos productivos con los que le brindara mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, y una vez adquirido el credito solicitado logrará ser socio del trillo, que es su mayor sueño.
texts.en:
Donald Antonio is married. He is a small farmer who together with his father grows non-irrigated and irrigated rice. This business allows them to provide the family (4 younger siblings, his mother and friend) sustenance. He lives with his parents. Very early every day they do the necessary cultivation work to guarantee their harvests. He is asking for a loan to become a partner in the construction of a rice threshing machine in his community. This will allow him greater profits in their productive cycles. The profits would bring better living conditions for his family. Once he receives the loan he will be part of the group constructing the thresher, and that is his biggest dream.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the construction of a rice thresher

loans.name: Henry Cesar

texts.es:
